text:
I hate Professor Hernandez!
Me too! He keeps calling on us randomly during his lectures, demanding us to answer intricate questions on the spot. It's not only intimidating but also unfair, as we're not always prepared. However, I believe that his teaching methodology has a logic behind it. 

Professor Hernandez is a renowned scholar in the field of ancient history, and his lectures are a unique opportunity to delve deeper into the topic. He challenges us to expand our knowledge and deepen our understanding of the subject matter. Moreover, his questions test our ability to synthesize complex information from various sources, which is a crucial skill in academic research. 

Despite the challenges, some of us have learned to prepare better by reading extensively beforehand, taking meticulous notes during lectures, and actively engaging in class discussions. We've also started forming study groups to help each other understand the more intricate concepts. 

However, it's essential that Professor Hernandez finds a balance between challenging us and providing a safe learning environment.

label: C2
story:
I hate Professor Hernandez!
Me too! He keeps calling
text:
I hate Professor Hernandez!
Me too! He keeps calling us "mediocre" and "laggards" in class, as if we're unable to grasp even the most elementary concepts of advanced mathematics. But what he doesn't seem to understand is that we, his students, are not just passive recipients of knowledge; we're individuals with our unique learning styles, strengths, and weaknesses. 
Moreover, he insists on presenting the most complex equations and theories with a cursory explanation, expecting us to master them overnight. This pedagogical approach is not only ineffective but also deeply demotivating. It's like throwing a fishbone into a pool and expecting the fish to swim upstream. 
Furthermore, his lectures are often marred by erroneous assumptions and flawed logic. One time, he argued that the equation for a parabola could be derived from the equation for a circle. I couldn't believe my ears! It took me days to prove to my classmates and myself that Professor Hernandez was wrong, leaving me feeling frustrated and disillusioned.

We also researched additional resources to deepen our understanding. 
Moreover, we have identified the professor's weaknesses and approached him to ask for clarification. Surprisingly, he was receptive to our questions and even apologized for his less-than-stellar teaching.

story: Social media, magazines and shop windows bombard people
text:
Social media, magazines and shop windows bombard people with an unending torrent of information and advertisements, each vying for their attention. Amidst this cacophony, it is essential to distinguish facts from fiction, and to sift through the vast expanse of data, in order to make informed decisions. 

The art of discernment has become a crucial skill in our digitally-saturated age. The ability to critically analyze sources of information, and to evaluate their credibility and relevance, is an essential tool for navigating the modern world. 

Moreover, the capacity to extract meaning from complex texts is increasingly important in both personal and professional contexts. Reading comprehension skills, such as identifying the main themes, understanding the author's perspective, and making inferences, are indispensable for success in academia, business, and beyond. 

To develop these skills, it is important to engage in regular reading, preferably in a variety of genres, and to practice active reading techniques.

story: Social media, magazines and shop windows bombard people
text:
Social media, magazines and shop windows bombard people with an endless stream of fashion trends, promising to help us look stylish and attractive. However, not every fashion trend is suitable for every person or every occasion. In order to make a well-informed decision about what to wear, it is essential to evaluate the information from various sources and synthesize it to create a personal style that fits one's unique identity. 

Firstly, one can explore fashion blogs and social media influencers to discover the latest trends. These sources provide a wealth of information on the latest styles, colours, patterns and fabrics. For instance, a blog post titled "10 Must-Have Trends for Fall 2022" can offer valuable insights into the upcoming fashion scene. However, it is crucial to evaluate the reliability of these sources based on their expertise, credibility, and the authenticity of the information they provide. 

Another useful source of information is fashion magazines, which often offer expert opinions from fashion editors, designers, and stylists.

For example, a popular fashion trend might be wearing oversized sunglasses. People often follow this trend because they want to look stylish. But, some might think this trend is not for them, and they prefer to wear regular-sized sunglasses. 

Magazines feature articles on these trends, explaining why they are popular. Shop windows display mannequins wearing the latest outfits, showcasing the trend for all to see. Social media platforms like Instagram and TikTok spread the word, with many users posting pictures or videos of themselves wearing or using the trendy item. 

However, not everyone follows trends. Some people prefer to stick with what they like and are comfortable with. They might think that trends come and go too quickly or that they are just a waste of money. Others might not have the budget to keep up with the latest trends. 

Food trends are another area where people often follow the crowd.

label: B1
story: Social media, magazines and shop windows bombard people
text:
Social media, magazines and shop windows bombard people with endless advertisements every day, promoting the latest products and trends. These promotional materials have one goal: to captivate consumers and encourage them to make a purchase. 

The use of persuasive language is a common technique in advertising. For instance, a fashion brand may write, "Get ready to turn heads with our new collection!" or a food product might claim, "Indulge in the rich and delectable taste of our chocolate!" These catchy phrases aim to appeal to the emotions of consumers, creating a desire or need for the product. 

Moreover, advertising often employs contrast in order to highlight the superiority of their product. A skincare brand may advertise, "Say goodbye to dry, dull skin with our new moisturizing cream!" or a car advertisement might boast, "Experience the ultimate in comfort and performance with our luxury vehicle." By contrasting the problem (dry, dull skin or inadequate comfort and performance) with the solution (moisturizing cream or luxury vehicle), the advertiser emphasizes the benefits of their product.

label: C1
story: Social media, magazines and shop windows bombard people
text:
Social media, magazines and shop windows bombard people daily with an endless stream of information and advertisements, making it increasingly challenging for individuals to filter relevant content and make informed decisions. In the digital age, critical thinking has become a crucial skill in navigating the abundance of data and maintaining a healthy information diet. 

The first step in effective critical thinking is to identify the purpose and perspective of the information presented. This involves understanding the intended audience, the author's bias, and the underlying message. For instance, a news article reporting on a current event may be written from a particular political stance, and deciphering this bias can help readers evaluate the trustworthiness of the information. 

Another important aspect of critical thinking is the ability to analyse complex arguments and identify logical fallacies. Logical fallacies are errors in reasoning that can mislead and confuse. For example, the argument "every time it rains, I get a headache, therefore, it must be raining when I get a headache" falls under the category of "post hoc, ergo propter hoc" fallacy, which means "after this, therefore, because of this."

story: A baby has arms and legs. It has a mouth and eyes.
text:
A baby has arms and legs. It has a mouth and eyes. These are the primary organs which help it to interact with the world during its formative years. However, the human anatomy consists of far more complex structures, which play a crucial role in its development and overall survival. 

The nervous system, for instance, is a complex network of cells and fibers that coordinate bodily functions through receiving, processing, and transmitting signals. The brain is the central organ of the nervous system, and it is responsible for controlling the body's functions, including thought, perception, and emotion. 

The circulatory system transports essential nutrients, such as oxygen and glucose, and waste products to different parts of the body through a series of interconnected blood vessels. The heart is the central organ of the circulatory system, and it pumps blood to maintain an even flow of fluids within the body. 

Moreover, the respiratory system facilitates the exchange of gases between the body and the external environment, allowing us to breathe in oxygen and exhale carbon dioxide.

The infant's brain is a vast, uncharted terrain, teeming with neural connections that will form the foundation of its intellect and personality. Every sensation, every experience, every interaction will serve to strengthen or weaken these connections, shaping the neural networks and laying the groundwork for the complex cognitive abilities that will come to define the human experience. 

The child will soon learn to crawl, then to walk, run, and jump. It will acquire language, and with it, the power to communicate and to understand the complex tapestry of human relationships. story: A baby has arms and legs. It has a mouth and eyes.
text:
A baby has arms and legs. It has a mouth and eyes. It is a new life, a tiny being with a world of potential. However, this bundle of joy also presents challenges for its parents, particularly in the realm of sleep. Sleep is essential for a baby's development, yet it can be elusive for both the infant and the caregiver. 

Newborns require an average of 14 to 17 hours of sleep, but their sleep patterns are not consistent. They sleep for short durations throughout the day and night, and their circadian rhythms are not yet fully developed. Consequently, parents are often left grappling with sleep deprivation, which can lead to numerous health issues such as weakened immune system, mood swings, and memory impairment. 

To help ensure that baby and parent get the rest they need, it's important to establish a consistent bedtime routine. This can include activities like bathing, singing lullabies, feeding, and reading a book. By creating a predictable sequence of events, baby begins to recognize the cues that bedtime is approaching, making it easier for them to wind down.

label: C2
story: Most people don't know that the full name of the Statue
text:
Most people don't know that the full name of the Statue of Liberty is "Liberty Enlightening the World." This iconic symbol of freedom stands tall on Liberty Island in New York Harbor, a beacon of hope for millions of immigrants who arrived in the United States in search of a better life. 

The statue's intricate design reflects the rich cultural heritage of France, which gifted it to the United States in 1886. Lady Liberty, as she is affectionately called, is a colossal sculpture with an height of 151 feet from the base to the tip of her torch. The statue is composed of copper sheets, which have turned from their original green color to a brownish patina over time. 

The statue's most striking feature is Lady Liberty's raised right arm, holding a torch in her hand. This symbolizes the enlightenment that comes with knowledge and education. The left hand, on the other hand, is holding a tablet inscribed with the date of the American Declaration of Independence, July 4, 1776. This represents the idea of opportunity and freedom that the United States offers.

label: B2
story: Most people don't know that the full name of the Statue
text:
Most people don't know that the full name of the Statue of Liberty is "Liberty Enlightening the World." This iconic landmark, located at the entrance of New York Harbor, is a gift from the people of France to the United States in celebration of their friendship and alliance. It was designed by French sculptor Bartholdi and constructed between 1875 and 1884. 

The statue stands majestically on a pedestal that was financed by donations from Americans, largely through a massive fundraising campaign spearheaded by newspaper publisher Joseph Pulitzer. The pedestal was designed by Richard Morris Hunt. Together, the statue and pedestal stand at an impressive height of 305 feet. 

At the base of the pedestal, there is an inscription that reads, "Give me your tired, your poor, your huddled masses yearning to breathe free, the wretched refuse of your teeming shores. Send these, the homeless, tempest-tost to me, I lift my lamp beside the golden door!" These words, written by Emma Lazarus, are a call to welcome immigrants and have become a symbol of hope and opportunity for millions of people worldwide.

label: B1
story: Most people don't know that the full name of the Statue
text:
Most people don't know that the full name of the Statue of Liberty is "Liberty Enlightening the World." This iconic symbol of freedom stands tall on Liberty Island in New York Harbor. The statue is a gift from the people of France to the United States, a token of friendship and appreciation. 

Built between 1875 and 1884, the statue is a masterpiece of Neoclassical sculpture. It represents Lady Liberty holding a torch in her right hand and a tablet in her left, on which is inscribed the date of the American Declaration of Independence. Her crown is topped with a radiant halo, symbolizing enlightenment. 

The statue's construction was a challenging endeavor, requiring the collaboration of many skilled artisans and engineers. The copper sheets that make up the statue's exterior were assembled in France and then shipped to New York, where they were fitted together on the statue's frame. Finally, the statue was lifted and installed on a pedestal, a process that took several days. 

Today, the Statue of Liberty is a popular tourist attraction, drawing millions of visitors every year.

story: Karen and Jack had been trying to have a child for
text:
Karen and Jack had been trying to have a child for several years without success. Their hearts ached with the longing that seemed to grow stronger with each passing month. The medical tests they underwent revealed no apparent reason for their inability to conceive. Frustrated and disheartened, they sought the advice of Dr. Thompson, a renowned fertility specialist. 

Dr. Thompson, a seasoned professional with a distinguished career, listened attentively to their situation. His gaze bore the weight of countless similar cases, yet he maintained an air of optimism. He explained that their predicament was far from unusual and that numerous treatments were available to help them realize their dream of parenthood. 

The doctor proposed a series of diagnostic tests and treatments, which included intrauterine insemination, in vitro fertilization, and the use of donor eggs or sperm. Each procedure came with its own advantages and disadvantages, risks and benefits. Dr. Thompson provided them with a comprehensive analysis of each option, explaining the intricacies of the procedures and their chances of success.

One day, while browsing the internet, Karen stumbled upon an article about the benefits of acupuncture for fertility. Intrigued, she shared the article with Jack, and they decided to give it a try. After conducting thorough research on the subject, they selected a qualified acupuncturist and began attending regular sessions. 

The acupuncturist explained that traditional Chinese medicine believes that the flow of Qi, or energy, is essential for a balanced reproductive system. By inserting fine needles at specific points on the body, she aimed to stimulate the energy flow and promote overall health. Karen and Jack were skeptical at first, but they soon began to notice changes in their bodies. 

After a few weeks of treatment, Karen's menstrual cycle became more regular, and she felt more energetic.

At their first consult, the specialist listened intently as they recounted their plight.

I pondered the implications of this shift, weighing the potential benefits and challenges of entering the realm of computer science. 

My initial apprehension was rooted in the belief that the two disciplines were vastly different, incompatible even. But upon delving deeper into the subject matter, I discovered that they intersected in fascinating ways. I acknowledged that such a transition would not be easy.

text:
Karen and Jack had been trying to have a child for many years. They loved each other very much and wanted a family. Karen was a teacher, and Jack worked as a mechanic in a garage. They enjoyed their weekends together, going for long walks in the park and watching TV in the evenings. 

Karen liked to paint and draw, and Jack enjoyed fixing things. They had two small dogs, Max and Benny, who always accompanied them on their walks. Max was a brown terrier, and Benny was a small white poodle. They both adored the dogs and took good care of them. 

One day, Karen went to the doctor for a check-up. She was happy to hear that she was finally pregnant. Jack was thrilled when she told him the news. They were overjoyed and couldn't wait to meet their little baby. They started preparing the house for the new arrival, buying baby clothes and furniture. They were excited about the future and looked forward to starting a family. 

Karen continued to take good care of herself, eating healthy foods and taking vitamins. Jack supported her in every way he could, bringing her flowers and helping with the household chores.

label: A2
story: I was wondering if I could change my major from biology
text:
I was wondering if I could change my major from biology to psychology. I love learning about the human mind, but I find biology classes quite boring and difficult. My friend suggested that I consider psychology, and I thought it was a great idea. However, I'm worried about the workload and the challenges that come with a new major. Maybe I should talk to my academic advisor and discuss my concerns. 

I enjoy reading books on psychology and watching documentaries about human behavior. My fascination with the subject grew stronger when I took a psychology class last semester. But, the biology lectures are making me question my choice. It's not that I don't like science, but biology is just not my cup of tea. 

Because I'm unsure about making this decision, I've been researching the psychology program extensively. I read about the courses, the career opportunities, and the professors. And, I've even reached out to current students for their insights. It seems that psychology aligns more with my academic and professional interests than biology.

label: B1
story: I was wondering if I could change my major from biology
text:
I was wondering if I could change my major from biology to mathematics. I've always had a strong interest in numbers and equations, which is not quite the same as my initial fascination with living organisms. I've been pondering this decision for quite some time, and I've weighed the pros and cons. 

On the one hand, studying mathematics would satisfy my intellectual curiosity, and I believe it would also open up a wider range of career opportunities. However, I'd have to face the challenge of adjusting to new study material, and I'd need to dedicate myself to mastering the subject. 

Moreover, there are financial aspects to consider. My parents have invested considerable resources in my biology education, and they'd be disappointed if I made a sudden change. I'd have to find a way to explain my decision to them and reassure them of the benefits of this new direction. 

In addition, I'd need to consider how this decision would affect my social life. Many of my closest friends are in the biology department, and a change of major would mean leaving that social circle.

label: C1
story: I was wondering if I could change my major from biology
text:
I was wondering if I could change my major from biology to psychology, a decision that has been weighing heavily on my mind for quite some time now. While both disciplines share some commonalities, they are fundamentally distinct in their approaches to understanding the natural world and the human condition. 

Biology, by definition, is the science of life and living organisms. It explores the intricate workings of cells, organ systems, and ecological relationships, seeking to explain the mechanisms behind life processes. In this field, I have developed a strong foundation in scientific principles, research methods, and critical thinking, skills that are invaluable in any academic pursuit. 

However, I have recently discovered a deep fascination with the human mind and behavior. The complexity of the human psyche, with its myriad of emotions, thoughts, and experiences, has become increasingly intriguing to me. This is where psychology comes in. As the scientific study of behavior and mental processes, it offers unique insights into the workings of the human mind and its interaction with the environment.

label: C2
story: A bipartisan group of women senators waded into the
text:
A bipartisan group of women senators waded into the contentious debates surrounding reproductive rights this week, proposing a comprehensive legislative package aimed at safeguarding access to essential healthcare services for millions of women across the United States. The Women's Health Protection Act, introduced by Senators Richard Durbin and Tammy Duckworth, is an ambitious piece of legislation that seeks to counteract a flurry of restrictive state-level measures enacted over the past few years. 

At its core, the proposed act asserts a woman's fundamental right to make informed decisions about her own body and health, free from political interference. By codifying this right into federal law, the Women's Health Protection Act would prevent states from enacting legislation that undermines that right, including provisions that ban or severely restrict access to abortion services. Additionally, the bill would protect the ability of healthcare providers to offer abortion care services without fear of prosecution or civil liability.

label: B2
story: A bipartisan group of women senators waded into the
text:
A bipartisan group of women senators waded into the contentious issue of gender pay equality in the labor market, releasing a meticulously crafted report detailing the persistent wage gap that continues to favor men over their feminine counterparts. This comprehensive study, compiled after months of rigorous research, provides an in-depth analysis of the factors contributing to this disparity in earnings, drawing from a wide range of reputable sources. 

The report commences by underscoring the significant body of evidence corroborating the wage gap's existence, which persists despite variations in factors such as education, experience, and occupation. The senators emphasized that the gap is not simply an issue of women's choosing; instead, it is an endemic problem that calls for decisive policy interventions. 

The research subsequently explores the reasons behind the disparity, delving into intricacies such as occupational segregation, discrimination, and undervaluing of female-dominated professions. The authors of the report argue that the underrepresentation of women in high-paying fields and the overrepresentation in low-paying ones exacerbates the income gap.

label: A2
story: A bipartisan group of women senators waded into the
text:
A bipartisan group of women senators waded into the contentious health care debate. They argued for affordable care for all, while their adversaries pushed for less government involvement. The disagreement deepened, and emotions ran high. 

Senator Smith spoke in favor of increased funding for community health centers. "Because these centers are vital for low-income families," she explained. Senator Johnson countered, "But more funding means higher taxes, and that's not fair to hardworking Americans." 

Meanwhile, Senator Brown proposed a compromise. "Let's expand Medicaid coverage instead. And that way, we help those most in need, without burdening taxpayers," she suggested. 

The conversation continued late into the night, filled with passionate pleas and rational arguments. Despite their differences, all senators shared a common goal: to improve the lives of their constituents by providing better access to healthcare. 

In the end, the senators reached a consensus. They agreed to expand Medicaid coverage gradually and provide more funding for community health centers.

label: B1
story: A bipartisan group of women senators waded into the
text:
A bipartisan group of women senators waded into the contentious issue of gender pay equality, tabling a bill in Congress. The proposed legislation sought to eliminate the persistent gender wage gap, an inequity that has long been a thorn in the side of feminists. 

The bill, aptly named the "Equity for Women Act," aimed to address the root causes of this disparity. It proposed measures to ban wage discrimination based on gender in all sectors, including the public and private arenas. Furthermore, it mandated transparency in wage practices, requiring employers to publicly disclose salary data to ensure equal pay for comparable work. 

The senators argued that the gender wage gap was an issue not only of fairness but also of economic efficiency. They cited numerous studies demonstrating that closing the gap would not only benefit women but also boost the economy. Moreover, they emphasized that addressing this issue would send a strong message that the United States was committed to upholding the principles of equality enshrined in its Constitution.

story: A bipartisan group of women senators waded into the
text:
A bipartisan group of women senators waded into the debate about equal pay for equal work. They shared their personal stories of wage disparity, citing examples from their families and communities. One senator described how her sister earned less despite having identical job titles and responsibilities. Another revealed that her own pay was lower than her male colleagues. These lawmakers expressed their support for equal pay legislation, emphasizing fairness and justice. They signed a statement, pledging to vote for the bill. 

The equal pay issue is not just a women's concern; it's an issue for families. When women earn less, families struggle to make ends meet. It's not fair! We need laws to make sure men and women receive equal pay, no matter their gender. It's important for everyone, especially parents, to understand this. 

Some people argue that women choose lower-paying careers or jobs with less hours. But the truth is, women often face barriers to career advancement because of gender bias. They are paid less for doing the same work and are denied promotions or raises, even when they are qualified and hardworking.

story: Two weeks into the U.S. government shutdown and, days
text:
Two weeks into the U.S. government shutdown and, days after the missed deadline for debt ceiling negotiation, the financial markets began to show signs of turbulence. The S&P 500 index saw its sharpest decline in over seven years, and the yield on the ten-year U. S. Treasury note plunged below the 2. 5% mark in the midst of mounting uncertainty. 

The political stalemate, with no clear resolution in sight, left both investors and the broader public in a state of anxious anticipation. The consequences of such a prolonged impasse went beyond the financial realm, with potential ramifications for national security, international relations, and the economy at large. 

The impasse had its roots in a bitter standoff between the White House and the Republican-led Congress over the proposed Affordable Care Act (ACA), commonly known as Obamacare, and the ongoing budget dispute. The Democratic Party, controlling the executive branch, and the Republican Party, controlling the legislative branch, found themselves unable to compromise on key provisions, resulting in the government closure and the suspension of various essential services.

People from all corners of the globe can now communicate in real-time, fostering a more interconnected and globalized society. 

Secondly, technology has transformed the way we access and disseminate information. The ubiquity of search engines like Google and online databases has made knowledge readily available at our fingertips. This information superhighway has not only empowered individuals to educate themselves on various topics but also facilitated a more informed and engaged populace. 

Furthermore, technology has significantly altered the landscape of business communication. With tools such as email, project management software, and virtual meetings, businesses can operate more efficiently and effectively, even if their team members are located in different parts of the world.

label: B2
story: Two weeks into the U.S. government shutdown and, days
text:
Two weeks into the U.S. government shutdown and, days before the Christmas holidays, tensions are escalating at an unprecedented rate. The impasse, initiated by the Democrats' refusal to approve funding for President Trump's proposed border wall, has left hundreds of thousands of federal employees without wages. 

The situation has sparked a heated national debate, with each side presenting compelling arguments. The Republicans, led by the President, claim that the wall is essential for national security, citing instances of drug smuggling and illegal immigration. On the other hand, the Democrats assert that a border wall is an ineffective solution to the problem and that the money for its construction could be better allocated to other areas. 

At the heart of the disagreement are issues of border control and immigration policy. While there is broad consensus on the need for effective border security, there are significant differences in opinion regarding the role of a physical barrier in achieving that goal.

label: B1
story: Two weeks into the U.S. government shutdown and, days
text:
Two weeks into the U.S. government shutdown and, days before the deadline, Congress remains deadlocked over budget negotiations. With no clear end in sight, the impact of this prolonged impasse continues to reverberate throughout the nation. 

The effects on federal employees are palpable. Many are being forced to make difficult choices, such as going without pay or racking up debt to meet their basic necessities. Others are exploring alternate income streams, like selling possessions or taking on second jobs, just to get by. 

Meanwhile, the ripple effect of this crisis extends to businesses that rely on federal contracts. Their income streams are disrupted, causing uncertainty and potential layoffs. The longer this shutdown continues, the more widespread the economic fallout. 

Furthermore, vital services are being compromised. National parks are littered with trash, and important scientific research projects are on hold. In the healthcare sector, unpaid workers continue to provide care to their patients, but the lack of funding for preventative measures could result in a surge in health issues down the line.

label: A2
story: Two weeks into the U.S. government shutdown and, days
text:
Two weeks into the U.S. government shutdown and, days before Christmas, tensions grew. People waited in long lines for basic services and, in some cases, received no help at all. Many were frustrated, some even angry. 

Meanwhile, members of Congress met in private rooms to negotiate, but, so far, reaching a deal seemed impossible. The Democratic and Republican parties disagreed on funding for border wall construction. This impasse led to a political standoff. 

Some federal employees worked without pay while others joined the unemployment line. They needed the income to support their families. However, others sympathized with their plight and sent donations. This was a kindness that made a difference for those who received it. 

As Christmas approached, a glimmer of hope appeared. Both parties agreed to a temporary funding solution, preventing a catastrophe. However, the debate about border security and funding for a wall was far from over. 

Those most affected by the shutdown breathed a sigh of relief. They could now focus on enjoying the holiday season.

story: Two weeks into the U.S. government shutdown and, days
text:
Two weeks into the U.S. government shutdown and, days away from a possible debt ceiling crisis, the political impasse between Democrats and Republicans continues unabated. With no end in sight to the budget standoff, the consequences of this prolonged stalemate are becoming increasingly palpable for American citizens. 

At the heart of this crisis lies the issue of funding for the construction of a border wall along the Mexican border, a campaign promise made by President Donald Trump during his election campaign. Democrats, who control the House, are refusing to appropriate $5. 7 billion for the project, which they view as an expensive and ineffective solution to immigration issues. On the other side, Republicans, who hold the Senate and the White House, are insisting on including the funding in the budget bill. 

This impasse is causing chaos in various sectors of American society. Government workers, who have been furloughed or forced to work without pay, are facing financial difficulties. Essential services, such as air traffic control and food safety inspections, are being affected, potentially posing risks to public safety.

text:
-LRB- CNN -RRB- More than 22 months ago, the body of George Floyd, an unarmed African-American man, was brutally pinned down by Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin, igniting a global outcry against police brutality and systemic racism. This tragic incident served as a catalyst, fueling a wave of protests, which swept across the United States and beyond, calling for long-overdue change. 

In the aftermath, the Black Lives Matter (BLM) movement gained unprecedented traction, with millions taking to the streets to demand justice and equality. Simultaneously, the conversation surrounding race, prejudice, and police reform escalated to a level not seen in recent history, reaching far beyond the realm of activist circles to influence mainstream discourse. 

The ensuing months have seen a myriad of developments in various realms, from the political to the social, all aimed at addressing the root causes of systemic racism and inequality. Politicians, law enforcement agencies, and educational institutions, among others, have been compelled to acknowledge the urgency of these concerns and have initiated measures to rectify past wrongs and foster a more inclusive society.

label: B2
story: -LRB- CNN -RRB- More than 22 months ago, the body of
text:
-LRB- CNN -RRB- More than 22 months ago, the body of a young Syrian refugee named Alan Kurdi washed up on a Turkish beach, igniting a global outcry over Europe's refugee crisis. The image of his lifeless body, a toddler in a red t-shirt and blue jeans laying face down on the sand, shocked the world, bringing the human cost of the crisis to the forefront. 

The crisis, which began in 2011 during the Arab Spring uprisings, has since seen millions of people fleeing their homes due to violence, persecution, and poverty. The vast majority of refugees have sought refuge in neighboring countries, while a smaller but significant number have attempted to make the perilous journey to Europe in search of safety and better opportunities. 

The situation came to a head in 2015, when more than one million refugees arrived on European shores, overwhelming border agencies and testing the limits of national asylum systems. Germany, with its generous welcome policy, became the top destination for many refugees, while countries like Hungary and Austria erected physical barriers to keep them out.

This event sparked nationwide protests against police brutality and racial injustice, igniting a long-overdue conversation regarding systemic racism and police reform. 

-LRB- George Floyd's tragic demise -RRB- was a tipping point for many Americans, who could no longer ignore the prevalence of police brutality against Black people. In the following months, protests erupted in various cities across the United States, drawing attention to the unjust treatment and discrimination faced by the Black community. 

-LRB- As a result of the public outcry -RRB- , various reforms have been proposed and implemented, including defunding the police, police retraining programs, and increased community involvement in policing. These efforts aim to address the systemic issues that contribute to police brutality and racial profiling.

Doors close 5 minutes before the scheduled start time. calculus students are required to bring pencils, erasers, and calculators to the examination room. label: A1
story: Two weeks into the U.S. government shutdown and, days
text:
Two weeks into the U.S. government shutdown and, days without pay, I feel the pinch. Money tight, I must save. Groceries sparse. No more fancy meals. Eat simple. Fruits, bread, rice. No more cinema, no more art shows. Stay home. 

Walking dog Max in the park, fresh air good, sun shining bright. Max happy, chasing birds. Nature's beauty, no admission fee. Free joy. 

Family close, we help each other, strong. Parents understanding, my sister, supportive. Grandma, always there with wisdom and love. We share stories, eat together. Simple pleasures, precious. 

No Netflix now, just my thoughts. I paint, colorful pictures, bring life to paper. I read, learn Spanish, dream of Spain. Music, my solace, soothes my soul. Free entertainment. 

Days blend, but spirits high. Adversity, a test, we face it, strong. Together we stand, hope we shall find. Brighter days, they say, are coming. Stay positive. Stay strong. 

Simple words, simple pleasures. Love, support, hope. Togetherness, resilience, determination. We'll get through this, together.

label: C1
story: -LRB- CNN -RRB- More than 22 months ago, the body of
text:
-LRB- CNN -RRB- More than 22 months ago, the body of George Floyd, an unarmed African American man, was left motionless under the knee of Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin, sparking an outcry around the world. The harrowing footage of Floyd's death was a poignant reminder of the systemic injustice and racial inequality that persists in the United States. The incident ignited a global movement, Black Lives Matter, which gained momentum as protests against police brutality and racial discrimination spread to every corner of the globe. 

- Subsidiary point: George Floyd's death and the ensuing protests were not isolated events. Rather, they represented the tipping point in a decades-long struggle against racial injustice and discrimination. 

Despite the progress made in civil rights since the 1960s, it is clear that structural racism continues to affect the lives of African Americans. For decades, they have been disproportionately impacted by poverty, unemployment, and poor education. The lack of economic opportunities and systemic bias in the criminal justice system have perpetuated cycles of intergenerational poverty and perpetuated the perception that Black lives matter less than others.

text:
Poster 1
FINAL EXAM INSTRUCTIONS
Doors close 5 minutes prior to the scheduled start time. Calculators are permitted for specific sections only. The format of the exam consists of multiple-choice and open-ended questions. The exam is divided into three sections: Mathematics, Science, and Literature. Candidates are encouraged to read each question carefully, and answer all parts of a question before moving on to the next. 

Section 1: Mathematics
This section assesses candidates' abilities to apply mathematical principles and concepts to solve problems. Candidates are expected to use mathematical notation accurately, as well as provide clear explanations and justifications for their answers. 

Question 1:
A function f(x) = mx^2 + bx + c is given. If f(2) = 4 and f(3) = 14, what are the values of m, b, and c? 

Question 2:
Solve the system of linear equations: 2x + 3y = 5, 4x - y = 2

Section 2: Science
Section 2 tests candidates' ability to apply scientific knowledge and concepts. This section includes questions that require candidates to analyze and interpret data, as well as draw conclusions based on evidence.

FINAL EXAM INSTRUCTIONS
Doors close 5 minutes prior to the actual exam start time. No electronic devices are permitted in the exam room. Make sure to bring a pen and a pencil with an eraser. You will be provided with a calculator during the math section. 

Section 1: Multiple choice questions - 30 minutes
Read each question attentively and mark your answers in the corresponding boxes on your answer sheet. Each question is equal in weight. There are no penalties for wrong answers, so answer every question. 

Section 2: Short essay - 20 minutes
In this section, you will be given a topic, and you will need to write a coherent essay in response. The topic will be provided on the exam paper and your essay should be at least 200 words long. Be sure to include an introduction, body, and conclusion in your essay. 

Section 3: Listening and reading comprehension - 40 minutes
This section will test your ability to understand and respond to a variety of texts and audio recordings. You will be given time to read each text and listen to each recording before responding.

text:
And now, the rejects.
The photographs show the Boeing 737 Max, a modern aircraft with advanced features that unfortunately met a tragic end due to a series of unfortunate events. The first incident occurred in October 2018 when Lion Air Flight 610 crashed shortly after takeoff, killing all 189 passengers and crew members on board. Just five months later, in March 2019, Ethiopian Airlines Flight 302 suffered a similar fate, taking the lives of 157 people. 
Both accidents were attributed to a single cause: the malfunctioning of the Maneuvering Characteristics Augmentation System (MCAS), a crucial safety feature designed to prevent stall conditions and improve handling. It is believed that a fault in the system caused it to repeatedly push the nose down, despite the pilots' efforts to counteract it, leading to the fatal crashes. 
The Boeing Company, faced with mounting criticism and legal action, responded by grounding all 737 Max planes worldwide and implementing software updates to the MCAS system. However, many question whether these measures go far enough to address the underlying issues.

Section B: Essay writing - 45 points
In this section, you will be required to write an essay on a given topic. The topic will be provided on the exam paper. You have 45 minutes to plan, write, and revise your essay. story: The president she once pointed a gun at has been dead
text:
The president she once pointed a gun at has been dead for over a decade, yet Maris Olivetska's haunting memories of that fateful day continue to linger in her consciousness. The year was 2005, and Maris, an unassuming journalist for the Baltic Tribune, found herself in the heart of the chaos that unfolded in Riga, Latvia. The president, Viktors Kalvins, had called for a nationwide address, urging citizens to unite in the face of a perceived threat from external forces. In the hours that followed, however, the situation took a dramatic turn. 

The air was thick with tension as the president, clad in military fatigues, emerged from the presidential palace with an entourage of heavily-armed soldiers. Maris and her colleagues from the press corps stood at a respectable distance, their cameras poised, as the president addressed the assembled throng. But as he began to speak, something shifted in the mood of the crowd. 

The president's words grew increasingly erratic and agitated. He spoke of treachery from within, of a plot to overthrow the government.

Born into the political elite, daughter of the country's founding father, General Aung San, Suu Kyi studied in the United Kingdom, where she met and later married Michael Aris, an Oxford scholar. During that time, Suu Kyi's commitment to democracy and non-violent resistance never wavered. The military junta, determined to crush any dissent, isolated her from her family and the outside world. Despite this, she remained a beacon of hope for her people, who looked to her for leadership and inspiration. Her speeches, often delivered to throngs of supporters gathered outside her house, were broadcast clandestinely on shortwave radio. These addresses, full of eloquence and conviction, became a rallying cry for the pro-democracy movement.

text:
The British tourist who caught a 1-year-old child who had fallen from a balcony at a Spanish beach resort was hailed as a hero by witnesses and local authorities. In the 16th century, the Loire Valley was the center of power and opulence, with its magnificent chateaux that dotted the riverbanks. These grandiose edifices were the residences of the kings and queens, who sought refuge from the chaotic urban life of the court. 

Each chateau tells a unique story. For instance, Chateau Chambord, with its double helix staircase and intricate facades, was designed as a hunting lodge for King Francois I. Chateau Chenonceau, famously known as the "Chateau of the Ladies," was ruled by influential women who shaped its destiny. 

The valley's allure extends beyond its historical significance. It is also a gourmet's paradise. The region's rich soil produces some of the finest wines, cheeses, and fruits in France. The Loire Valley has a reputation for its culinary specialties such as roasted chestnuts, rillettes, and the famous goat cheese log. 

Nestled between the Chateau d'Amboise and Chateau du Clos Luc, lies the quaint town of Amboise.

story: One of the darkest days in American history was September
text:
One of the darkest days in American history was September 11, 2001, when terrorist attacks on the World Trade Center towers and the Pentagon changed the course of our nation forever. In the early morning hours, nineteen militants, affiliated with the extremist group al-Qaeda, hijacked four commercial airplanes. Their plan was to crash the planes into symbolic targets, leaving a trail of destruction and loss. 

The first attack occurred at 8:46 a. m. when American Airlines Flight 11, en route from Boston to Los Angeles, struck the North Tower of the World Trade Center, causing a massive explosion. Minutes later, at 9:03 a. m., United Airlines Flight 175 collided into the South Tower, creating another catastrophic scene. These events unfolded live on television, leaving the world in shock. 

Meanwhile, United Airlines Flight 93, initially intended to target the Capitol building, was diverted towards the White House. However, passengers, learning of the previous crashes and determined to prevent another atrocity, overtook the hijackers and crashed the plane into a field in Pennsylvania, thus saving thousands of potential lives.

C., but the passengers fought back against the hijackers, resulting in the crash of the plane in a field in Pennsylvania.

With a total area of 42,000 hectares, this hunting lodge is not only a marvel of architecture but also a symbol of power and wealth. Its imposing double helix staircase, a precursor to the modern-day escalator, was a display of innovation at the time, as it allowed the king and queen to ascend and descend without crossing paths. 

Moving on, Chteau de Chenonceau, known as the "ladies' chteau," has an intriguing history. Dating back to the 16th century, it is the only castle in the Loire Valley that spans the Cher River. It has been owned and inhabited by many influential women throughout history, each leaving her mark on the castle.

story: Halloween is on October 31. It is also called All Hallows'
text:
Halloween is on October 31. It is also called All Hallows' Eve, and it is a day when people, particularly children, dress up in costumes and go door-to-door in their neighborhoods to collect candies and other treats. The origin of this custom can be traced back to the ancient Celtic festival Samhain, celebrated more than 2000 years ago. 

The Celts believed that on the night before their new year, the boundary between the worlds of the living and the dead became blurred, and the ghosts of the dead returned to earth. In order to appease these spirits, they would light bonfires and wear costumes to disguise themselves. The Romans subsequently adopted this festival and added their own influences, such as the focus on saints and martyrs, giving rise to the Catholic feast day of All Saints Day on November 1. 

Today, Halloween traditions vary widely, but some common elements include carving jack-o-lanterns, making and telling scary stories, playing pranks, and decorating homes and public places. The popularity of Halloween has spread to many parts of the world, with each culture adding its own unique twists and variations.

With a sense of excitement and anticipation, he gathered his friends, all eager to test out this new toy in the expansive backyard of his family's countryside estate. However, before the day's festivities could commence, Scott deemed it necessary to establish some ground rules to ensure safety and fairness. 

The sun began to climb the eastern sky as the friends assembled, their laughter echoing through the tranquil morning air. As they awaited Scott's arrival, they engaged in lively discussions about tactics, weapons, and the boundaries of the playing area. Once Scott appeared with the paintball gun and paintballs, they gathered around him, ears pricked and eager for instruction. 

Scott cleared his throat and addressed the group. "Alright, mates. We've all been looking forward to this, but in order to make it a fun and enjoyable day for everyone, we need to set some ground rules. First, safety. No shooting at the face, and absolutely no shooting anyone from behind without warning.

label: B1
story: Scott received a paintball gun and some paintballs
text:
Scott received a paintball gun and some paintballs as a gift for his birthday. He was thrilled about the new toy and could hardly contain his excitement. His friends had suggested going to the nearby forest to play a paintball game. 

Preparation for the exciting day began the night before. Scott laid out his camouflage clothing, ensuring every piece was clean and wrinkle-free. The gear, including the paintball mask and protective vest, was carefully examined for any damages. After ensuring everything was in order, he set out the paintballs, dividing them into two piles. One pile was for himself and the other was for his friends. 

The following morning, Scott eagerly joined his friends at the forest clearing. A friendly greeting and a quick rundown of the rules were all it took to start the adrenaline pumping. The players split into two teams and chose sides. The excitement was contagious as everyone donned their protective gear, grabbed their painted guns and positioned themselves strategically around the play area.

label: A2
story: Halloween is on October 31. It is also called All Hallows'
text:
Halloween is on October 31. It is also called All Hallows' Eve. We wear costumes and go door-to-door for candies. I love this holiday. I prepare my costume weeks before. I usually make it myself. last year, I dressed up as a clown. My brother and I went together. He was a jester. We had a lot of fun. This year, I want to be a superhero. I will make a cape and a mask. I'm excited to trick-or-treat again. 

I like Halloween because it's fun and exciting. We decorate our homes and streets with pumpkins and ghosts. At night, we go out in groups. Candles in jack-o'-lanterns light up the porches. We knock on doors, say "trick or treat" and receive candies. Sometimes, we play pranks on our friends. We share our candies with each other. 

However, not everyone enjoys this holiday. Some people find it scary or irrelevant. They don't celebrate it. Others have allergies or dietary restrictions. For them, it might be difficult to participate fully. Therefore, we should be considerate and inclusive. We can offer non-food treats, like stickers or toys, to those who can't eat candies.

story: Just a two-hour detour from Paris, the Loire was once
text:
Just a two-hour detour from Paris, the Loire was once a royal river. Kings and queens built magnificent chateaux along its shores. I love this place, so peaceful and beautiful.

label: B2
story: When you apply for public housing, on the application
text:
When you apply for public housing, on the application form, you are required to provide numerous pieces of information about yourself. To ensure a successful application, it is crucial to understand the requirements and prepare the documents accordingly. 

First and foremost, you must meet the eligibility criteria. The criteria may vary depending on the specific housing authority; however, common factors include being a US citizen or eligible immigrant, having a low to moderate income, and meeting certain residency requirements. To demonstrate eligibility, you must present documents such as proof of identity, income, and residency. 

Once eligibility is established, you will need to complete the application form in its entirety. It is imperative to read the instructions carefully and provide all necessary information accurately and honestly. Failing to do so may result in denial of the application or further complications. 

Additionally, you will need to rank your housing preferences. This may include choosing a location, number of bedrooms, and other amenities.

label: C2
story: When you apply for public housing, on the application
text:
When you apply for public housing, on the application form, you will be asked to provide a plethora of personal details. These details, though seemingly mundane, are essential in determining your eligibility for housing assistance. 

Firstly, you will be required to disclose your current address and household composition. This includes the names of all members living in the household, their ages, and their relationship to you. Furthermore, you will need to specify your income sources, including employment income, welfare benefits, and any other forms of regular income. 

Additionally, you will be asked to provide proof of your identity, such as a passport or national ID card, as well as proof of citizenship or residency status. If you are a refugee or asylum seeker, you will be expected to provide your status details, including the date of application and the country of origin. 

Moreover, you will need to demonstrate your current living conditions by providing documentation of your current rent or mortgage payments, utility bills, and any other housing-related expenses.

label: C1
story: Halloween is on October 31. It is also called All Hallows'
text:
Halloween is on October 31. It is also called All Hallows' Eve, a day that marks the beginning of the Allhallowtide, the time dedicated to honoring the dead. The origins of Halloween date back over two thousand years, with its roots in the ancient Celtic festival of Samhain. 

The Celts believed that on the night before their new year (November 1), the boundary between the living world and the world of the dead became blurred, leading to the belief that the dead could return. People built huge bonfires to keep the evil spirits at bay, while wearing costumes and masks to mimic the souls of the dead and protect themselves. 

Over time, this ancient pagan celebration merged with the Christian feast of All Saints' Day. By the Middle Ages in Europe, Halloween had evolved into a night filled with mischief and revelry. The custom of dressing up in costumes and asking for "soul cakes," or small treats, in exchange for prayers for the dead, became a popular tradition. 

Today, Halloween has transformed into a global commercial holiday, with many people dressing up in costumes, carving pumpkins into jack-o'-lanterns, and partaking in candy and treats.

label: B1
story: When you apply for public housing, on the application
text:
When you apply for public housing, on the application form, there are several important requirements to fulfill. First, you need to provide proof of identity, such as a passport or national ID card. Then, you have to demonstrate your residency status in the area. A utility bill or rent receipt is usually enough as evidence. Afterward, you are required to declare your income and financial situation. Provide copies of your pay stubs, tax returns, and bank statements. Furthermore, you may be asked to give information about your household members. Their names, dates of birth, and relation to you must be documented. 

To increase your chances of being accepted for public housing, it is recommended to provide as much documentation as possible. This shows that you are honest and trustworthy. Incomplete applications will most likely be rejected, leading to disappointment and delays. 

Upon receiving your application, a housing authority officer will review it. If they need further clarification, they will contact you.

label: A2
story: Scott received a paintball gun and some paintballs
text:
Scott received a paintball gun and some paintballs as a gift. He was excited and wanted to play with his friends. They all gathered at the park, ready for an adventure. The sun was shining, the grass was green, and the trees were full of leaves. 

We split into two teams and chose sides. Team red versus team blue. I joined Team Red, and we discussed our strategy. We decided to hide behind the big tree, ambush our opponents as they approached the center flag. The other team had the same idea. 

The referee blew the whistle, and the game began. We ran towards our positions and hid, waiting for our enemies to arrive. Suddenly, gunshots rang out, and I saw my teammate fall to the ground. I was worried and wanted to help. 

I peeked out from behind the tree, ready to defend. But I saw that my teammate was only pretending to be injured, trying to distract the other team. I smiled and returned to my position. 

The game continued, with both teams taking turns attacking and defending. At one point, I hit a member of the other team, but he retaliated and hit me back.

label: A1
story: One of the darkest days in American history was September
text:
One of the darkest days in American history was September 11, 2001. I remember that day clearly. I wake up early, sun bright. Radio playing in kitchen. Sudden loud noise. Big explosion. New York City, Twin Towers, terrible, terrible. People screaming. Smoke high in sky. My heart, heavy. Scared, very scared. Friends, family, phone, worried. News, bad news. World changes, sad, sad. 

Another thing that brings me joy is my dog, Max. Furry, brown, big eyes. Bark, wag tail, happy. Throw ball, fetch. Run, run, play. Good boy, good friend. Comfort, love, home. 

In my free time, I like to paint pictures. Colors, brush, canvas. Red, blue, green. Mountains, trees, sky. Relax, think, create. Peaceful, quiet, alone. Art, beauty, expression. 

Food is another big part of my life. Cook, eat, enjoy. Chicken, rice, veggies. Sweet, salty, spicy. Apple pie, chocolate cake. Full, satisfied, happy. 

Music, music everywhere. Sing, dance, move. Rock, pop, classical. Loud, soft, fast. Fun, happy, relaxing. Radio, iPod, concerts. Music, my friend.

label: B2
story: Johnny Carson served as host for the iconic, late-night
text:
Johnny Carson served as host for the iconic, late-night television program "The Tonight Show" from October 1, 1962, until May 22, 1992. His tenure spanned over three decades, making it one of the longest-running tenures in television history. Carson's wit, charisma, and ability to adapt to an ever-evolving cultural landscape propelled "The Tonight Show" to the pinnacle of television entertainment. 

Born on October 23, 1925, in Corning, Iowa, Carson displayed an early aptitude for humor. He honed his skills as a radio announcer and comic before eventually transitioning to television. His first TV gig came in 1949, as the host of the television quiz show "Who Do You Trust?" After a meteoric rise in the industry, Carson became a mainstay on television, gracing the small screen in various capacities until his retirement from "The Tonight Show" in 1992. 

Carson's impact on "The Tonight Show" cannot be overstated. His ability to engage with a diverse array of guests, from politicians and celebrities to ordinary individuals, allowed the program to resonate with viewers from all walks of life.

text:

Firstly, the safety precautions were paramount in his mind. He recollected a news article about an incident where a stray paintball had resulted in a serious injury. Hence, he checked the barrel for obstructions and examined the safety mechanism, ensuring that it was securely engaged. 

Secondly, Scott reflected upon his knowledge of paintball etiquette. He knew that it was imperative to avoid shooting at people without warning, and to aim only at designated targets. Furthermore, he recalled a rule that paintball games were meant to be fun, not a means to intimidate or bully others. 

Thirdly, Scott considered the physical demands of the game. His previous experience had involved a leisurely round with friends in the park.

label: C2
story: Johnny Carson served as host for the iconic, late-night
text:
Johnny Carson served as host for the iconic, late-night television program, The Tonight Show, for three decades, from 1962 to 1992. A veritable master of his craft, Carson effortlessly navigated the complexities of live television, expertly balancing comedy, interviews, and monologues to create an entertaining and engaging viewing experience for millions of Americans every night. 

Carson's skillful use of language was a defining characteristic of his tenure on The Tonight Show. He frequently employs figurative language to add color and depth to his jokes, such as when he quipped, "I told my wife she was drawing her eyebrows too high. She looked surprised." With a wry twist of irony, he observed, "I told my wife she was drawing her eyebrows too high. She looked surprised. I told her it was a figure of speech." 

Additionally, Carson's monologues often showcased his impressive command of vocabulary and syntax. He could seamlessly weave together intricate sentences, as when he joked, "I've given up playing poker because it's a game where even a mere chance of losing a fortune is too infrequent."

label: B1
story: Johnny Carson served as host for the iconic, late-night
text:
Johnny Carson served as host for the iconic, late-night talk show, "The Tonight Show," from October 1962 to May 1992. He brought charm and wit to millions of viewers each night, leaving an indelible mark on American television. 

Born on October 23, 1925, in Corning, Iowa, Carson began his broadcasting career in radio. He worked as a disc jockey and announcer before moving to television in 1949. However, Carson's big break came when he was chosen to host "The Tonight Show," initially as a temporary replacement for Steve Allen. 

His natural ability to connect with audiences through humor quickly made him a favorite among viewers. Carson's monologues, interviews, and comedic skits kept viewers engaged and entertained late into the night. The show's format, featuring a relaxed atmosphere, allowed Carson to interact with his guests and audience in a way that felt authentic and personal. 

Carson's interviews were not limited to celebrities, however. He welcomed politicians, authors, musicians, and everyday people onto his show, creating a platform for diverse voices and perspectives.

story: When you apply for public housing, on the application
text:
When you apply for public housing, on the application form, you must provide several important documents. First, you need to give your identification papers. Additionally, you need to present proof of income. Why is this necessary? The housing authority needs to ensure that you meet the eligibility requirements. 

Furthermore, you have to provide details about your family members who will live with you. Each person needs to have their own identification document. Sometimes, children under a certain age do not require a separate document, but you should double-check with the housing authority. 

Moreover, you need to supply proof of residence, for example, a utility bill or a lease agreement. These documents demonstrate that you have been living in the area for a certain period. 

In summary, to successfully apply for public housing, you need to present your identification papers, proof of income, details of your family members and documentation for your residence. Remember, it's essential to double-check the exact requirements with your local housing authority to avoid any potential issues.

text:
Gabriela worked for a multinational company as a successful salesperson. She liked her job because she met new people every day. Her colleagues were friendly, and the office was near her home. text:

label: B1
story: Helen turned on her flashlight. Nothing happened. The
text:
Helen turned on her flashlight. Nothing happened. The batteries must be dead, she thought, feeling a pang of disappointment. She had planned to explore the old forest tonight, to discover its hidden wonders. Instead, she would have to postpone her adventure until another time. 

She stepped back from the battery compartment, squinting at the small print on the label. Alkaline batteries. She had bought the wrong ones, perhaps, in her haste to leave home. Now, she was forced to make a decision. She could either go back and fetch the correct batteries or venture forth into the forest with her phone as the only source of light. 

Helen hesitated, glancing at the darkened forest before her. The trees loomed menacingly, their branches swaying gently in the wind. She imagined all sorts of creatures lurking in the shadows, waiting to pounce on unsuspecting intruders. But she also remembered the stories she had read about brave explorers who had faced their fears and ventured into the unknown. 

With a deep breath, she decided to press on.

label: C2
story: Helen turned on her flashlight. Nothing happened. The
text:
Helen turned on her flashlight. Nothing happened. The room plunged into complete darkness, and the air grew thick with unease. She could hear the steady ticking of the clock in the silence, each tick a reminder of the passing time. Her heart pounded in her chest, the fear clawing at her insides, threatening to overwhelm her. 

The power outage was the latest in a series of inexplicable events that had occurred in the small village nestled in the heart of the forest. It wasn't the first time Helen had found herself in the darkness. She had spent countless nights awake, listening to the whispers of the wind, the eerie calls of unidentified creatures, and the incessant drip of water. Each night, she clutched her worn-out teddy bear, a relic from her childhood, and whispered reassurances to herself, her voice barely a whisper in the night. 

The villagers, however, were less sanguine about the situation. They spoke of ancient legends, of creatures long thought extinct rising once more to claim their territory. Helen dismissed such stories as mere superstition.

label: B2
story: Helen turned on her flashlight. Nothing happened. The
text:
Helen turned on her flashlight. Nothing happened. The room was pitch black, save for the beam of light piercing the darkness. With a sigh, she checked the batteries. They were fresh, but her torch refused to work. Unwilling to give up, she searched her backpack for an alternative. 

Inside, she found a small lantern, its glass bulb still intact. She struck a match against the rough side of the box and held it under the lantern's wick. A warm, steady glow filled the room as the flame took hold. Relief washed over her, and she let out a breath she hadn't realised she was holding. 

Despite her initial frustration, Helen was determined to press on with her research. The forested region she was exploring was rich in biodiversity, and she wasn't about to let a faulty flashlight derail her progress. She had spent weeks preparing for this expedition, and she wasn't going to let anything stand in her way. 

To her right, the trees towered over her, their leaves shimmering in the lantern light. To her left, the undergrowth rustled softly as insects and small creatures scurried about their nightly routines.

story: Two years ago, I graduated from high school. My father,
text:
Two years ago, I graduated from high school. My father, a devoted engineer, always dreamed of having an engineer in the family. Therefore, I decided to follow in his footsteps and study engineering in college. I applied for several universities, all of which offered strong engineering programs. After much consideration, I chose the one with a strong emphasis on innovation and research. 

I began my undergraduate studies in civil engineering. The first semester was challenging, filled with a multitude of new concepts and theories. However, the dedicated professors made the learning process enjoyable and engaging. We learned about the fundamental principles of engineering design, structural analysis, and construction techniques. I was particularly fascinated by the intricacies of structural analysis, which involved determining the ability of structures to withstand various types of loads. 

During the second semester, we put our theoretical knowledge into practice. We worked in teams to design and build small-scale models of structures, such as bridges and towers.

label: A2
story: Helen turned on her flashlight. Nothing happened. The
text:
Helen turned on her flashlight. Nothing happened. The batteries were dead. She felt disappointed. But she didn't give up. She remembered her Swiss Army knife. With a few quick movements, she opened the knife, took out the blade, and replaced the dead batteries. Her flashlight worked again. She breathed a sigh of relief. Now she could continue her hike through the forest. 

The moon shone brightly through the trees. Birds chirped in the distance. Deer roamed in the meadows. The fresh scent of pine filled the air. Helen walked on, feeling rejuvenated. She was grateful for the small emergency kit in her backpack. It saved her when she needed it most. 

Suddenly, she heard twigs snapping nearby. Her heart raced. A deer? A wild boar? She shone her flashlight around, but saw nothing. She stood still and listened. She heard rustling sounds and the sound of breathing. It was not a deer. Her fear turned into excitement. She reached for her phone, but realized she left it in her car. She sighed and cursed herself. But she knew she had to act fast.

Two years ago, I graduated from high school. My father, a successful entrepreneur, expressed his expectations for me to follow in his footsteps and build a prosperous career in the corporate world. However, my passions lay in the field of environmental sciences and the arts. 

The tension between fulfilling my father's dreams and nurturing my own ambitions created a significant rift within our family. I grappled with this complex dilemma, contemplating the potential risks of disobeying him and the possible outcomes of pursuing my passions. 

My inner turmoil intensified as I weighed the advantages and disadvantages of each path. Should I conform to societal expectations and embark on a lucrative business career, or should I follow my heart, despite the potential financial insecurities, and dedicate my life to environmental conservation and the arts? 

In order to make an informed decision, I extensively researched both fields, seeking the counsel of industry experts and academic mentors. I attended lectures, seminars, and conferences, absorbing as much knowledge as possible on the latest trends, innovations, and opportunities in each domain.

text:
Report on staff engagement at Girox Foods
Introduction
At Girox Foods, our staff are the backbone of the company. Their commitment, motivation, and engagement play a vital role in ensuring the success of the business. In this report, I will discuss the various initiatives we have implemented to boost staff engagement at all levels of the organization. 

Background
Girox Foods is a leading producer and distributor of high-quality organic and natural food products. Our team comprises individuals from diverse backgrounds, each bringing unique skills and perspectives to the table. It is crucial to maintain a motivated and engaged workforce to keep up with the ever-evolving food industry. 

Initiatives to Enhance Staff Engagement

First, we have introduced regular team building activities to foster a sense of camaraderie among our employees. This includes monthly team lunches, where staff members can enjoy a meal together and discuss ongoing projects. We also organize off-site workshops and training sessions to encourage collaborative learning and knowledge sharing.

label: B2
story:

At
text:
Report on staff engagement at Girox Foods
Introduction
At Girox Foods, an innovative food processing company, staff engagement is a critical success factor for achieving the organization's objectives. This report will delve into the various strategies implemented to promote staff engagement, the benefits derived from such initiatives, and an evaluation of their effectiveness. 

Staff Engagement Strategies
Firstly, management at Girox Foods prioritizes open communication channels. Regular team meetings, weekly newsletters, and employee surveys provide opportunities for employees to express their concerns, suggestions, and ideas. Furthermore, a mentoring program matches new staff with seasoned employees, thereby fostering a supportive work environment and expediting the onboarding process. 

Another essential strategy at Girox Foods is offering professional development opportunities. Employees are encouraged to pursue further education, attend industry conferences, and participate in in-house training programs.

Introduction
At
text:
Report on staff engagement at Girox Foods
Introduction
At Girox Foods, the staff's engagement and morale have emerged as critical factors in ensuring the sustained growth and competitiveness of our organization. An engaged workforce is not only essential for improving productivity and employee retention but also instrumental in promoting innovation, enhancing the quality of our products, and fostering a positive work environment. In this report, we shall delve into the reasons behind the significance of staff engagement, discuss current initiatives to boost engagement levels, and suggest potential strategies for further enhancing this important aspect of our corporate culture. 

Significance of Staff Engagement
Research shows that engaged employees are more dedicated to their work, display higher levels of productivity, and contribute significantly to business success. They are more likely to exhibit greater job satisfaction, leading to reduced absenteeism and staff turnover. Furthermore, engaged employees are more likely to put in the extra effort required to meet business objectives and deliver exceptional customer service (Bersin & Associates, 2011).

The trees loomed ominously around her, their branches intertwining overhead to form a densely woven canopy that cast long, ominous shadows. The silence of the forest was broken only by the sound of her own footsteps as she picked her way carefully through the undergrowth.

As she walked, Helen began to feel a sense of unease. She was alone in the forest, and the storm had shown no signs of abating.

text:
Two years ago, I graduated from high school. My father, a doctor, urged me to study medicine. I wanted to become an artist. But my father insisted, "You must follow your dreams, but becoming an artist is not a reliable career choice." 

I worked hard at school, studying anatomy, chemistry, and biology. I didn't enjoy these subjects, but I knew it was important for my future. My father's words echoed in my mind, "You can do it, but you must be dedicated." 

Finally, the day came when I received my acceptance letter to medical school. I felt a mix of emotions. I was proud of myself, but sad that I couldn't follow my passion for art. But I knew that my parents, especially my father, would be happy. 

Medical school was challenging, and there were times when I regretted my decision. But I persevered and graduated at the top of my class. My father was proud of me, and I could see the relief in his eyes. He said, "You've proved me wrong, you can be both a doctor and an artist." 

Today, I'm a successful doctor and I paint in my free time.

label: A1
story: Scott received a paintball gun and some paintballs
text:
Scott received a paintball gun and some paintballs for his birthday. He loves this new toy! Every weekend, he goes to the park with his friends for a paintball game. They laugh and shout as they hit each other with the balls. After the game, they have a picnic under the tall trees. 

The sun sets, and Scott packs up his things. He smiles at his friends and says, "See you next week!" He goes home, happy and tired from the fun day. His dog, Max, greets him with wagging tail. Scott scratches Max behind the ears and they watch TV together. 

Max jumps off the couch when he hears the sound of the kitchen door opening. Scott makes him a special treat. Max wags his tail and eats the food with big slurps. Scott and Max snuggle on the couch, enjoying the cozy evening. 

Before going to bed, Scott checks his phone. He has messages from his friends asking when they will meet again for paintball. He writes "Next Saturday" and sends it back. He turns off the phone and closes his eyes, looking forward to another exciting week.

text:
Report on staff engagement at Girox Foods
Introduction
At Girox Foods,staff engagement is a key factor in ensuring the success of our business. I will discuss some reasons why staff engagement is essential and share some simple ways we have implemented to improve staff engagement. 

Firstly, engaged staff are productive staff
An engaged workforce is more productive and motivated. When employees feel valued and appreciated, they put more effort into their work. They are also more likely to take ownership of their tasks and contribute ideas for improvement. 

Secondly, happy staff make for happy customers
Engaged staff are more likely to have positive interactions with customers. They are more likely to go the extra mile to ensure customer satisfaction and deal with any issues effectively and efficiently. This leads to repeat business and positive reviews, which benefits the company in the long term. 

Thirdly, low engagement can lead to turnover
On the other hand, if staff feel disengaged, they may become demotivated and start looking for other opportunities.
