story: Nowadays all the information we could ever need is
text:
Nowadays all the information we could ever need is at our fingertips, thanks to the digital revolution. However, with an overwhelming amount of data available, it is essential that we learn how to navigate this sea of knowledge effectively and critically. 

Firstly, let us consider the various sources of information. They can be broadly categorized into primary and secondary sources. Primary sources are original documents, such as research papers, interviews, or experiments, whereas secondary sources are interpretations or explanations of primary sources, like textbooks, articles, or documentaries. It is imperative to recognize the distinction, as primary sources provide firsthand information, while secondary sources offer a more filtered and analyzed perspective. 

Next, let us discuss the process of gathering information. To conduct an effective search, we need to formulate precise and relevant keyword queries. These queries should be specific, avoiding ambiguous terms and using Boolean operators where possible.

For address, write: "My address is 123 Main Street." 

For contact number, write: "My phone number is 555-555-1234." 

For family members, write: "I live with my mother and two brothers." 

Remember, it's important to fill out the application completely and accurately. If you have any questions about the form, ask someone for help. It will increase your chances of being approved for public housing. 

Additionally, make sure to sign the application form at the end. This is necessary for processing your application. Good luck!

text:
Report on staff engagement at Girox Foods
Introduction
At Girox Foods, an international food conglomerate, employee engagement has long been recognized as a crucial factor in ensuring the success of our business. A highly engaged workforce not only leads to improved productivity and job satisfaction but also fosters a positive work environment and a strong corporate culture. In this report, I will provide an analysis of the current state of staff engagement at Girox Foods, identify key issues, and propose potential solutions. 
Current State of Staff Engagement
According to the latest employee engagement survey, only 58% of Girox Foods' staff report feeling engaged with their work, a figure significantly below the industry average of 72%. Moreover, the results revealed a marked disparity in engagement levels across different departments, with Production recording the lowest engagement rate of 48%, while R&D and Marketing reported the highest engagement levels of 72% and 65%, respectively. 
Key Issues
Several issues were identified as contributing to the low engagement levels amongst our staff.

label: A1
story: Helen turned on her flashlight. Nothing happened. The
text:
Helen turned on her flashlight. Nothing happened. The battery dead, she thought. Her cat, Whiskers, meowed softly from the kitchen. She went there, opened the cupboard, and took out a can of tuna. Whiskers purred, happy. Helen opened the can and scooped out the food with a spoon. After feeding her pet, she cleaned the dish. 

The clock struck midnight. Helen yawned and stretched. Time for bed, she decided. In her bedroom, she undressed and changed into comfortable pajamas. She brushed her teeth, washed her face, and climbed under the blankets. The moon shone brightly through the window, casting soft light on her room. She closed her eyes, tired from the day. Goodnight, she thought, and fell into a peaceful sleep. 

In the morning, Helen awoke to the sound of birds singing outside. She stretched, feeling refreshed. She made coffee and sat at the kitchen table to enjoy it. The sun streamed in through the window, making the room warm and cozy. Helen thought about the day ahead. Perhaps a walk in the park, she decided.

label: B1
story: A proposal for a digital version of the university
text:
A proposal for a digital version of the university library is under consideration. This modern initiative aims to enhance the learning experience and provide students with easier access to educational resources. The proposed project consists of three main parts: digitization, database creation, and user interface design. 

First, the collection of books and documents must be digitized. High-resolution scans will be taken of each item, while text recognition technology will ensure searchable text. Care will be taken to maintain the original form and condition of the documents, using non-invasive scanning methods. 

Next, a database will be created to host the digital collection. This comprehensive database will include detailed metadata, allowing users to easily search and filter content. It will be accessible through the university intranet, ensuring secure access for students and staff. 

Lastly, an intuitive user interface will be designed to enable users to effortlessly navigate the database and locate information.

label: B2
story: A proposal for a digital version of the university
text:
A proposal for a digital version of the university library: A comprehensive, forward-thinking concept

The digital age has significantly influenced the way knowledge is accessed and utilised, and the university library is no exception. In this age of rapidly increasing technological advancements, it is imperative for academic institutions to keep pace with the changing times by embracing digitalisation. This proposal outlines the concept of a digitised university library and its anticipated benefits, drawing from various authoritative sources. 

First and foremost, a digital library would allow students and faculty members unparalleled access to a vast collection of resources. With the implementation of an efficient search engine, users can effortlessly find the desired material, regardless of its physical location within the library. Moreover, digitalisation eliminates the need for travel to and from the library, saving time and resources for both the institution and its patrons (Farley, 2016). 

Moreover, a digital library offers the convenience of 24/7 access to information, enabling students and faculty to research and study whenever they desire.

A proposal for a digital version of the university library: I have an idea, it's about the library. We have an old library system, not digital. It causes many problems, like long queues and lost books. I think we need a change. So, I propose a digital library. 

Firstly, students and teachers can access digital versions of books, instead of physically visiting the library. No more queuing for hours to find a book or to return it. Secondly, digital books take less space, which is a big advantage for small libraries. Thirdly, e-books are easily searchable, saving time for users. 

However, some arguments against this solution may arise. For example, some people might say that digital books don't have the same feel as traditional ones. But, we can still have printed versions available for those who prefer them. Additionally, some students might not have the necessary devices to access digital books. However, we can provide computers and tablets for use in the library. 

Furthermore, this change will require a certain investment.

In the rapidly evolving digital age, traditional libraries have been faced with the challenge of adapting to new technologies and user preferences. Another significant advantage of a digital library is its ability to offer flexible access to resources.

Two years ago, Amy left her small hometown in England . She lived there with her parents and two younger brothers. Amy was tired of the monotonous life in the countryside. She dreamed of a big city where she could meet new people and have new experiences. London was her dream destination.

text:
1 Flappy Bird 
Be careful what you wish for, especially when it comes to addictive mobile games. Remember the craze surrounding Flappy Bird back in 2014? The game, with its simple design, challenged players to guide a bird between pipes without touching them. The sensation of victory was sweet; however, the game was notorious for its frustrating difficulty. Players became so engrossed in their quest for a high score that they could hardly put their phones down. 

2 A Global Sensation
Flappy Bird quickly spread like wildfire, capturing the minds of gamers worldwide. Its addictive nature was undeniable; players found themselves attempting to beat their high scores time and time again. Social media was filled with images of people's high scores and strategies for mastering the game. In fact, Flappy Bird reached such heights that it was even banned in Vietnam, its country of origin, due to its allegedly negative impact on productivity. 

3 The Creator Speaks
Despite its immense popularity, the game's creator, Dong Nguyen, was not pleased with the reaction.

Be careful what you wish for, especially
text:
1 Flappy Bird 
Be careful what you wish for, especially when it comes to addictive mobile games like Flappy Bird, which, with its seemingly elementary gameplay, has captivated millions worldwide since its release in 2013. In this simple yet challenging title, players guide a small bird through a series of pipes, tapping the screen to create the necessary upward force for each jump. The objective is to navigate the bird through the pipe maze without touching any of the pipes, which results in an immediate game over. 

At first glance, Flappy Bird appears to be a mere diversion, an impractical waste of time. However, its addictive nature can be attributed to several psychological elements that have been expertly woven into its design. For instance, the game's unforgiving nature demands perseverance and patience, as even the slightest miscalculation can lead to failure. Furthermore, the game offers just the right amount of reward, with each successful pipe-clearing leap providing a satisfying sense of accomplishment.

label: B2
story: Memorial Day is a United States holiday to remember
text:
Memorial Day is a United States holiday to remember and honor the men and women who have died while serving in the country's military. The holiday is observed on the last Monday of May every year. Although it was originally called Decoration Day, it later became known as Memorial Day due to the increasing importance placed upon remembering the lives lost in military service. 

The origins of Memorial Day trace back to the aftermath of the Civil War when communities would decorate the graves of soldiers with flowers. The first recorded instance of this practice was in Waterloo, New York, on May 5, 1866. The following year, Mayor Henry C. Welles proclaimed the day as Decoration Day and since then, it has become a national tradition. 

Memorial Day is not only a day for remembrance but also a day for honoring the sacrifices made by our veterans and their families. It signifies the start of the summer season and is often seen as a time for family gatherings, picnics, and parades. The significance of the day, however, should not be overshadowed by the festivities.

story: Memorial Day is a United States holiday to remember
text:
Memorial Day is a United States holiday to remember and honor the men and women who died while serving in the United States Armed Forces. This solemn observance is observed on the last Monday of May every year. It is a time for reflecting on the sacrifices made by our brave soldiers throughout history. 

The origin of Memorial Day can be traced back to the aftermath of the Civil War when citizens in towns and cities across the nation began Decorating the graves of fallen soldiers with flowers and wreaths. This tradition spread and eventually led to the establishment of a national holiday. The holiday was officially known as Decoration Day until 1967, when it was renamed Memorial Day. 

The significance of Memorial Day transcends the borders of the United States as it is also observed in countries such as Australia and New Zealand. However, each country has its unique traditions. In the United States, for instance, the day is often marked by attending parades, visiting cemeteries where loved ones are buried, and placing American flags and flowers on their graves.

label: C1
story: Ever since Mary moved to the United States one year
text:
Ever since Mary moved to the United States one year ago, she has been intrigued by the intricacies of American politics. Initially, she was drawn in by the heated debates among her coworkers and acquaintances. However, as she delved deeper into the subject, she discovered a complex web of political structures and processes that defied her initial simplistic perceptions. 

To begin with, the American political system is characterized by a separation of powers, which divides the government into distinct branches. The Legislative branch, made up of the Senate and the House of Representatives, makes and passes laws. The Executive branch, headed by the President, enforces and implements those laws. Lastly, the Judicial branch, composed of federal courts, interprets and enforces the laws and the Constitution. This system, although efficient in preventing any one branch from gaining too much power, can also create gridlock and inefficiency. 

Another crucial aspect of American politics is the two-party system. The Democratic and Republican parties have dominated the political landscape since the late 1800s.

text:
Hi, can you help me find a book on tigers?
Yes, of course! I'd be happy to help. There are numerous books available on this fascinating topic. One recommended title is "Tigers: A Photographic Exploration of the World's Most Endangered Big Cat" by Steve Winter and Ceri Levy. This beautifully illustrated book provides an in-depth look at the biology, behavior, and conservation efforts surrounding these magnificent creatures. 
Moreover, "Tiger: A Natural History" by Alistair Griffiths is another excellent choice. Griffiths delves into the natural history of tigers, exploring their physical characteristics, habitats, and social structures. Furthermore, he discusses the threats they face, such as poaching and habitat loss, and the efforts to protect them. 
For those seeking a more in-depth analysis of the political and social aspects of tiger conservation, "Saving Tiger: Politics, Culture, and Conservation in India and China" by Deborah C. Padfield is a valuable resource. This book offers a critical analysis of the complex issues surrounding tiger conservation in India and China, including conflicts between conservation and local communities, economic development, and cultural beliefs.

This solemn observance is observed on the last Monday of May each year, and it marks the start of the summer season. 

The origins of Memorial Day can be traced back to the aftermath of the Civil War, when communities would decorate the graves of fallen soldiers with flowers and flags. The first official Decoration Day was observed on May 30, 1868, when General John Logan, the National Commander of the Grand Army of the Republic, issued a proclamation calling on Americans to decorate the graves of their fallen heroes with flowers and flags. 

Throughout history, Memorial Day has evolved into a time for families and friends to gather together, typically at cemeteries or national memorials, to pay their respects to those who have given their lives in defense of the nation. It is a time for solemn reflection, as we ponder the sacrifices that have been made by the brave individuals who have served in our armed forces.

The tiger population has declined dramatically over the past century. According to the World Wildlife Fund, there are fewer than 4,000 tigers left in the wild. Poaching remains another persistent threat, with tiger parts being highly valued in traditional Chinese medicine and other cultural practices.

story:
I'm interested in signing up for your cable service.
Alright,
text:
I'm interested in signing up for your cable service.
Alright, here's what I need from you. Name, please? 
My name is Sarah. I'd like the basic package, please. 
Okay, Sarah, that will be $50 a month. What's your address? 
I live on 123 Main Street. I'd prefer to pay monthly by check. 
Sure thing, Sarah. We'll send you a form in the mail. Do you have any questions about the package? 
No, that's all I need for now. Thank you. 
You're welcome, Sarah. We'll process your application as soon as possible. Do you have a phone number where we can reach you? 
Yes, it's 555-1234. Is there anything else I need to provide? 
No, that's all. We'll be in touch when your service is ready to be activated. Goodbye for now. 
Bye, have a great day. 

Here are some of the grammar constructs used at CEFR level A1:

* I'd like (verb + infinitive)
* Here's what I need from you (subordinating conjunction introducing a clause)
* Do you have (auxiliary verb + question word)
* That will be (modal verb)
* What's your (question word) + possessive pronoun
* We'll send you (infinitive)
* Do I have to (modal verb + auxiliary verb + subject + infinitive)
* Process your application

text:
The regulation eight hours in the office is over. Employees leave their desks, eager to escape the monotonous routine, seeking solace in the comfort of their homes or engaging in leisure activities. Yet, the notion of a work-life balance is increasingly becoming a myth in today's hyper-competitive corporate landscape. 

As a result, the demand for flexible work arrangements that prioritize employees' well-being has escalated. Remote work, flexible hours, and job-sharing are some of the solutions that have gained prominence in recent years. However, the implementation of such policies is not an easy feat for organizations, requiring careful planning, effective communication, and technological support. 

Remote work, for instance, necessitates a reliable internet connection, a quiet workspace, and a disciplined approach to time management. Moreover, it demands a high level of trust and communication between employers and employees, as well as a strong company culture to ensure productivity and teamwork. 

Flexible hours, on the other hand, can accommodate employees' individual needs and preferences, leading to higher job satisfaction and morale.

label: C1
story:
Dear Ms Leitman,
I am writing to request your help
text:
Dear Ms Leitman,
I am writing to request your help in addressing a complex issue that has been plaguing our community for quite some time: the increasing rate of plastic waste pollution. This problem is not unique to our town, but it is a global concern that requires immediate attention and action from each and every one of us. 

First and foremost, it is essential to understand the gravity of the situation. According to recent statistics, it is estimated that there will be more plastic than fish in the ocean by 2050 if current trends continue (United Nations, 2018). This alarming prediction highlights the urgency of finding effective solutions to reduce plastic waste production and disposal. 

One of the primary sources of plastic waste is single-use plastics, such as water bottles, plastic bags, and food packaging. These items are used for a short period before being discarded, contributing to an excessive amount of waste that ends up in landfills or, worse, the environment. Therefore, a crucial step towards addressing this issue is reducing the usage of single-use plastics.

label: C1
story: The regulation eight hours in the office is over.
text:
The regulation eight hours in the office is over. In the contemporary professional landscape, remote work has become an increasingly popular option, allowing individuals to maintain a work-life balance while enhancing productivity. However, this shift towards flexible work arrangements poses challenges for both employers and employees. 

Firstly, remote work demands a high level of self-discipline and organization from employees. Without the physical presence of colleagues or a manager, it can be challenging to maintain focus, meet deadlines, and establish clear communication channels. In fact, a study conducted by Gallup found that unstructured workday and work environment are among the primary reasons employees are disengaged, which can negatively impact their overall job performance. 

On the other hand, employers face the challenge of ensuring that remote employees remain engaged and productive. With the absence of direct supervision, it can be difficult for managers to assess the progress of their team members and provide timely feedback.

label: B1
story: The Marlboro Man was a fictional character who appeared
text:
The Marlboro Man was a fictional character who appeared in Marlboro cigarettes print advertisements during the mid-20th century in the United States. He was depicted as a rugged cowboy, sitting astride a horse in the wild west landscapes. The campaign was a resounding success, and the Marlboro Man became an enduring symbol of American masculinity. 

The Marlboro Man's story began back in the 1950s when filtered cigarettes started gaining popularity. In order to stand out from the competition, the tobacco company Philip Morris came up with an innovative marketing strategy. They created the Marlboro Man image, a tough and independent figure who symbolized freedom, adventure, and ruggedness. 

The ads featuring the Marlboro Man were designed to appeal to men, particularly those who were drawn to the romanticized idea of the west and the outdoors. The images showed the Marlboro Man in various settings, from riding his horse through the wilderness to sitting by a campfire, a cigarette in hand. The tagline "Come to the Marlboro Country" became synonymous with the brand, and the advertising campaign was a huge success.

Mary's family back in Poland thinks she's crazy to live in a foreign land all alone, where she knows nobody. But Mary's heart is full of dreams and ambitions. She wants to learn new things and explore this strange, fascinating new world. 

She goes to English language classes every day and is trying her best to make friends. Sometimes she feels like giving up and going back home. text:
She walked along the sidewalk. She wasn't paying attention. Suddenly, a car screeched to a halt in front of her. The driver's door swungopen. A man jumped out, shouting, "Watch where you're going, lady!" He was red-faced and angry. 

She was shocked. Apologizing profusely, she tried her best to gather her wits. Why was this man behaving so aggressively? She looked up and saw him pacing angrily beside her. "Are you going to stand there gawking or are you going to get out of my way?" he demanded. 

Frightened, she stepped aside and watched as he got back into his car. It revved up and drove off, leaving a cloud of dust in its wake. She stood there, shaken, trying to make sense of what had just happened. Why had the man been so angry with her? Had she really been that distracted? 

She continued on her way, her thoughts a whirl. She couldn't help but replay the incident over and over in her mind. What could she have done differently? Should she have apologized more sincerely? Should she have stood her ground? 

She arrived at her destination, a small cafe tucked away on a quiet side street.

The Marlboro Man was always shown riding a horse, wearing a cowboy hat, and holding a cigarette. He looked very tough and independent. His image appealed to many people, especially men. But, smoking is bad for health. It causes many diseases such as cancer and heart disease. 

Therefore, Marlboro had to change their advertising strategy. They introduced new campaigns that focused on the taste and flavor of their cigarettes. But some people still miss the Marlboro Man. They remember him fondly and with nostalgia. 

In conclusion, the Marlboro Man was an iconic figure in advertising history. He represented freedom and the wild west. But, due to health concerns, Marlboro had to stop using him. However, his image still lives on in people's memories.

label: C1
story: The Marlboro Man was a fictional character who appeared
text:
The Marlboro Man was a fictional character who appeared in Marlboro cigarettes' advertising campaigns from the 1950s through the 1990s. This iconic figure, portrayed as a rugged, independent cowboy, was instrumental in transforming Marlboro from a minor brand into a global market leader. However, beyond the marketing success, the Marlboro Man image has become a symbol of masculinity, virility, and the American Dream. 

The Marlboro Man first emerged in the late 1940s, and his image was based on the idealized portrayal of the American cowboy. These men were often portrayed as lone figures, taming the wild frontier and living a life of freedom and autonomy. The Marlboro Man embodied these ideals, but instead of actually being a cowboy, he was a symbol that represented the lifestyle and the aspirations of the post-War consumer. 

The Marlboro advertisements featured stunning visuals of the American West, with vast open landscapes and sweeping vistas. The Marlboro Man was always shown in these settings, with a Marlboro cigarette hanging from his lips, exuding a sense of confidence and self-reliance.

Conversations flowed freely around the table, the laughter and joy adding to the overall atmosphere. The dishes were then cleared, and the evening continued with relaxation in the living room. 

The night ended with his children tucked in bed, their peaceful slumber a welcome respite for the weary father. He lay in bed, reflecting on the day and the simple pleasure of a home-cooked meal shared with his loves ones.

The next day, she met him at the park. They picked up where they left off. They talked about their dreams.

Moving to the balance sheet, you notice several significant trends. There is a noticeable increase in accounts receivable, which could potentially indicate a growing issue with customer payments.

text:

The fare, paid either with cash or a pre-purchased ticket, is displayed on the ticket machine or announced by the bus driver as the bus approaches the designated stops. 

The bus journey comes to an end when the bus reaches the last stop on the route or when passengers signal the bus driver to stop at a designated bus stop.

text:
Riding the bus is as easy as pie. The bus driver is always there to lend a helping hand, guiding us through the intricacies of the public transportation system. However, this seemingly simple act hides a multitude of complexities. 

First and foremost, understanding the various bus routes and schedules requires a solid foundation of logical reasoning. Each route follows its designated pathway, and the interconnections between them form an intricate web. By analyzing the map and deciphering the timetables, commuters can efficiently plan their journeys, taking into account factors such as transfers and bus frequencies. 

Moreover, time management comes into play when deciding which bus to take. Waiting for a bus can be an arduous task, especially when dealing with unpredictable factors such as traffic and delays. Consequently, it's essential to evaluate the pros and cons of different options and make informed decisions, all while maintaining flexibility to adapt to ever-changing circumstances. 

Adding to the complexity is the necessity of acquiring the practical skills required for navigating the bus system.

story: Writing in the journal Nature, former president of
text:
Writing in the journal Nature, former president of the American Chemical Society, Dr. Thomas Hagen, presents a compelling argument for the importance of sustainable agriculture. In the opening paragraph, he establishes the relevance of the topic, explaining that "with a global population projected to reach 9. 7 billion by 2050, sustainable agriculture has become a crucial element in ensuring food security for future generations." 

In the second paragraph, Hagen discusses current agricultural practices, pointing out that while traditional methods have fed the world for centuries, they are no longer sufficient to meet the demands of an ever-growing population. He states that "intensive farming methods, such as monoculture and heavy use of fertilizers and pesticides, have resulted in environmental degradation and negative health effects for farmers and consumers alike." 

In the third paragraph, Hagen introduces the concept of sustainable agriculture, explaining that it encompasses practices that "promote productivity, improve soil health, and reduce the environmental impact of agriculture."

text:
Riding the bus is as easy as pie. The bus driver is an exemplary professional, his demeanor radiating an aura of competence and authority. The bus interior is a microcosm of societal diversity, a mosaic where each passenger contributes a unique and irreplaceable piece. 

The journey is a sensory experience par excellence, replete with intriguing aromas from the street vendors outside, mingling with the faint scent of exhaust fumes and the subtle perfume of the upholstery. The cacophony of sounds, the rustle of the leaves, and the gentle hum of the engine provide a soothing symphony, an auditory counterpoint to the visual kaleidoscope outside. 

Moreover, bus travel is a social experience, where chance encounters foster unexpected connections. Conversations with fellow passengers, though brief, can lead to the discovery of shared interests, or a new perspective on an old issue. The exchange of stories and ideas serves to bridge gaps, fostering a sense of community and shared humanity.

story: Your manager stops you and says she needs to have a
text:
Your manager stops you and says she needs to have a serious talk. You feel nervous and anxious. She sits down and starts speaking in a stern voice. "I have some concerns about your recent performance at work," she says. "You've missed several deadlines and your reports have had mistakes." 

You listen carefully and hang your head in shame. "I'm sorry," you reply. "I've had some personal issues that have been distracting me. I promise to do better." 

Your manager looks unimpressed. "We all experience personal problems," she says. "But your job requires consistency and accuracy. You need to understand the importance of meeting deadlines." 

You nod in agreement. "I understand," you reply. "I will make a plan to manage my time better and prioritize my work." 

Your manager nods back. "That's what I want to hear," she says. "And I believe in you. But you need to show improvement soon." 

You leave the meeting feeling determined to do better. You know that making excuses won't help, and you need to take responsibility for your actions.

story: Some of the biggest and most expensive transportation
text:
Some of the biggest and most expensive transportation projects in the world are often met with controversy and opposition from various stakeholders. For instance, the High Speed 2 rail project in the United Kingdom, also known as HS2, has been a subject of intense debate for several years. 

The HS2 project aims to construct a new high-speed railway line connecting London and the Midlands, with further extensions planned to reach cities in the North of England. Proponents argue that the railway will significantly reduce travel times between London and the North, boost economic growth, and decrease carbon emissions by encouraging people to travel by train instead of flying or using cars. 

However, opponents voice concerns over the project's cost, which is estimated to reach over 100 billion (approximately $131 billion). Critics argue that the money could be better spent on existing infrastructure, such as schools, hospitals, and social housing. They also point out that the project may lead to the displacement of thousands of people, including those living in the areas where new railway stations will be built.

Beginning with a somber assessment of the current state of Europe's economies, the authors assert that "the Covid-19 pandemic has brought the European Union to a crossroads: a choice between maintaining an economic model that benefits a privileged few, or forging a new path towards a more equitable and sustainable economy" (Juncker & Piketty, 2020, p. 1). 

To elucidate, they argue that the pandemic has exposed the inherent weaknesses of neoliberal economic policies that have long reigned in Europe. Policies that prioritized individual liberty over collective welfare have resulted in widespread poverty, precarious employment, and income inequality. As the authors astutely observe, "the virus does not discriminate between borders, but Europes response has been unequal to the task" (Juncker & Piketty, 2020, p.

text:
Dear Ms Leitman,
I am writing to request your help . I like cats very much, but my pet cat disappeared last week. I feel unhappy and worried. I want to find it as soon as possible. I checked the neighborhood but could not find my cat. I hope you can help me with some ideas. I will be very grateful. 

I have a few questions: Have you seen my cat around your house? What does my cat look like? It's a black and white cat, medium size. It's very friendly and has a small scar on its ear. I gave it some food yesterday, but it didn't show up. I think it might be lost. 

I would be very thankful if you could spread the word around the neighborhood or keep an eye out for my cat. I can give you a flyer with a picture and description. Please let me know if you can help in any way. 

Thank you for your kindness and understanding. I hope we can find my beloved friend again soon.

story: Some of the biggest and most expensive transportation
text:
Some of the biggest and most expensive transportation projects in history have been meticulously planned and executed with remarkable finesse, leading to awe-inspiring feats of engineering. These endeavors, which span different modes of transportation and continents, exemplify the human capacity for innovation and problem-solving. 

Let us begin our exploration with the Trans-Siberian Railway, the longest railway in the world. This colossal project, which spans over 9,289 kilometers, was initiated in 1891, with the first section completed in 1916. Linking Moscow with Vladivostok, the railway passes through eight time zones and traverses the heart of Asia, connecting major cities such as Yekaterinburg, Novosibirsk, and Ulan-Ude. Despite the numerous challenges posed by the vast, unforgiving landscapes, the railway was completed, revolutionizing transportation between Europe and the Far East. 

Another engineering marvel is the Suez Canal, a waterway that connects the Mediterranean Sea to the Red Sea and provides a shortcut for ships traveling between Europe and India.

story: Writing in the journal Nature, former president of
text:
Writing in the journal Nature, former president of the American Physical Society, David Gross, eloquently discusses the current state and future direction of fundamental physics research. The field, he argues, has reached a crossroads, with two distinct approaches vying for prominence - the Standard Model of particle physics and the quest for a Theory of Everything (ToE), on one hand, and the search for new phenomena and the exploration of the multidisciplinary landscape of physics on the other. 

Gross begins by highlighting the remarkable achievements of the Standard Model, which has not only provided a remarkably successful description of the strong, weak, and electromagnetic forces, but has also predicted the existence of Higgs boson, which was discovered at the Large Hadron Collider in 20 12. Yet, despite these triumphs, the Model falls short of providing a complete understanding of nature - it cannot explain gravity or the observed matter-antimatter asymmetry, for instance. 

To address these shortcomings, the pursuit of a ToE has emerged as a prominent research direction.

Some of the biggest and most expensive transportation methods are aircraft and cars. Airplanes allow people to travel long distances quickly, but they are costly. Cars are more affordable for short trips, but they require fuel and maintenance expense.

Boats are another way to travel, particularly for those going to islands or coastal regions. They offer a unique travel experience, allowing passengers to enjoy the sea views. However, boats can be slow and unreliable in bad weather conditions, making them not the best choice for long or urgent trips. 

Walking and cycling are the cheapest transportation methods, and they have health benefits. Walking is free, and it is good exercise. Cycling also offers a low-cost, eco-friendly way to travel short distances.

Some of the biggest and most expensive transportation projects in the world have been meticulously planned to ease traffic congestion, enhance connectivity, and stimulate economic growth. One such endeavor is the High-Speed Rail (HSR) network in China, which has been transforming the country's transportation landscape since its inception in 2007. 

The Chinese HSR network, currently boasting over 30,000 kilometers of track, is the longest in the world, connecting major cities like Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou, and Hong Kong. The project's sheer scale and complexity are mind-boggling. Each HSR train can reach speeds of up to 375 kilometers per hour, making it significantly faster than traditional trains. Moreover, the HSR network's infrastructure consists of advanced signaling systems, dedicated tracks, and state-of-the-art rolling stock. 

One of the primary reasons behind the Chinese HSR's success is its ability to address the country's pressing transportation issues. Before the HSR network's implementation, China's roads were clogged with cars, trucks, and buses, leading to extensive traffic jams that cost the economy billions of dollars in wasted time and fuel.

Baseball, also known as America's pastime, is a traditional sport characterized by its slow-paced gameplay and distinctive elements such as the home run. The game's intricacies involve strategy, endurance, and teamwork, requiring players to focus intensely.

The fanbase for both sports varies, with baseball often being seen as a more traditional and family-oriented pastime, while basketball attracts a younger, more diverse demographic.

The objective is to score runs, which are accomplished by hitting the ball thrown by the opposing team's pitcher and then touching all four bases in a counterclockwise direction. The team with the most runs at the end of the game emerges as the victor. 

The baseball season spans from late winter to early fall, comprising 162 regular-season games for each team. During this period, teams engage in rigorous training regimes, honing their skills both physically and mentally to prepare themselves for the intense competition. Each team's performance is closely monitored, with standings updated daily, and fans eagerly anticipating each match-up.

The labyrinthine streets of Srinagar are a testament to the rich history that this place holds. Winding lanes, lined with quaint shops selling traditional handicrafts, meander through the old town. The air carried the sweet aroma of freshly prepared kahwa, a traditional spiced green tea, wafting from the numerous tea stalls that peppered the streets. 

A short walk from the old town, the tranquil Dal Lake beckoned, reflecting the clear blue sky and the magnificent Chattrchal shrine on its pristine waters. The shikaras, houseboats with intricately carved wooden interiors, dotted the lake, adding an air of serenity and romance. 

Despite its charm, Srinagar was not immune to the ravages of time, and change was slowly creeping in.

Gary Johnson and Virgil Goode have no chance of winning the upcoming presidential election. These two third-party candidates hold minimal appeal to the electorate due to their small campaign budgets, limited name recognition, and insignificant support from key political figures. 

Johnson, the Libertarian Party nominee, lacks the resources to effectively campaign in all 50 states against the major contenders, Donald Trump and Joe Biden. Moreover, his libertarian views on issues such as drug legalization and small government may be too extreme for the majority of voters. 

Goode, on the other hand, has an even smaller chance of success as the candidate of the Constitution Party. His ultraconservative stance on immigration and opposition to common educational practices, such as Common Core, may be appealing to a niche audience, but he has not gained enough traction to be a viable alternative to the major parties. 

Furthermore, both Johnson and Goode face challenges in securing a spot in the presidential debates.

Having your kid physically attached to you probably seems like an unusual concept in today's fast-paced society. Wearing your baby can also provide comfort to the child, as they feel safe and secure, especially in new environments. Furthermore, it keeps hands-free for other tasks like cooking or doing chores. 

Babywearing can be done in different positions to accommodate the growing infant. For instance, some parents prefer the backpack style when their little one gains more weight. Others may opt for a front carrier when their baby is still small. The possibilities are numerous, and the right position depends on both the parent and child's preference. 

Moreover, babywearing can have positive effects on the parent's wellbeing. For example, studies suggest that it may help in reducing back pain and improve posture. Additionally, wearing your child can lead to increased confidence and ease in navigating public spaces, as you are hands-free.

story: Gary Johnson and Virgil Goode have no chance of winning
text:
Gary Johnson and Virgil Goode have no chance of winning the upcoming presidential election, despite their third-party candidacy. The two Libertarian Party nominees face numerous challenges in their quest for the White House. 

Firstly, the electoral system in the United States heavily favors the two major parties, the Democratic and Republican Party, due to the "winner-takes-all" nature of the system. This means that in most states, all of the electoral votes go to the candidate who receives the majority of votes in that state, regardless of the margin. With the polls consistently showing Johnson and Goode trailing behind their major party opponents, Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump, it is highly unlikely that they will win any significant number of electoral votes. 

Secondly, the duo faces substantial financial disadvantages. The major parties have vast resources at their disposal, which allows them to saturate the airwaves with television advertisements and to hire a large staff to run their campaigns. In contrast, Johnson and Goode have far less money to spend, and their campaigns have struggled to generate the same level of media coverage and grassroots support.

This can be confirmed by checking the certifications on the label or the manufacturer's website. A safe carrier should have adjustable straps, sturdy construction, and a comfortable, supportive seat for the child. 

Next, ergonomics play a significant role in the choice of a baby carrier. A correctly positioned baby in a carrier reduces the pressure on the parents' back and neck, ensuring their comfort while also promoting optimal hip development for the child. Ergonomic carriers allow for proper hip positioning, with the child's legs spread wide and their knees higher than their hips.

label: C2
story: Gary Johnson and Virgil Goode have no chance of winning
text:
Gary Johnson and Virgil Goode have no chance of winning the upcoming presidential elections. Despite their valiant efforts and compelling messages, they face an insurmountable hurdle, namely the duopolistic nature of the American political landscape. The two-party system, dominated by the Democrats and Republicans, leaves little room for third-party candidates to gain a significant foothold. 

The electoral system itself is a major obstacle. The winner-takes-all system in place in most states ensures that a candidate must win a majority of the votes to secure all of that state's electoral college votes. This puts third-party candidates at a disadvantage, as they are often spliting the vote with one major party, making it virtually impossible for them to win. 

Moreover, the lack of media coverage and financial resources further exacerbates the difficulty for third-party candidates. The media, driven by ratings and advertising revenue, tend to focus their attention on the two major parties, leaving third-party candidates with limited opportunities to reach potential voters.

label: A1
story:
What do you plan to do after you graduate from here?
I'm
text:
What do you plan to do after you graduate from here?
I'm a big fan of cats. I have a lovely feline friend at home. 
Do you like dogs? I don't mind them, but cats are my preference. 
My family is very important to me. I have a brother and a sister. We often go out for meals together. 
What's your favorite food? My favorite food is pizza. Do you like pizza too? 
Can you help me write a letter to my pen pal? Yes, I can help you. What country is your pen pal from? 
What's the time now? I have to go, I'm late for a doctor's appointment. Goodbye! 
Can you give me directions to the park? Sure, turn left at the next corner, then go straight for two blocks, and the park will be on your right. 
Do you speak any other languages? No, I only speak English. Do you? 
Can I borrow a pen? Yes, please take one from the drawer. 
What day is your birthday? My birthday is on the 15th of May. When is yours? 
Can you repeat that sentence, please? Sure, "My birthday is on the 15th of May." 
What's the weather like today? It's sunny and warm today.

label: B1
story: It was Saturday morning. Mary walked out of her house
text:
It was Saturday morning. Mary walked out of her house , feeling the cool breeze on her face. She strolled along the park path, greeting other early morning walkers with a friendly smile. The sun was rising, casting long shadows on the ground. A gentle rain started to fall, making the leaves glisten. 

In the nearby pond, ducks paddled gracefully. Children's laughter could be heard from the playground, blending with the birds' melodic songs. Mary stopped for a moment to admire the beauty of nature around her. She felt a deep sense of calm and peace. 

As she continued her walk, she passed by the local bakery. The enticing smell of fresh bread wafted through the air. Mary decided to buy a croissant and a cup of coffee as a treat for herself. She sat on a bench, watching the raindrops on the leaves, listening to the soft sounds of nature. 

After finishing her coffee, Mary stood up and continued her walk. She passed by the local library, where she often spent hours reading. She wondered what new books she could borrow this week.

label: C1
story: Back in 2010, the old city in Srinagar was the sort
text:
Back in 2010, the old city in Srinagar was the sort of place where time seemed to stand still. Nestled in the picturesque Kashmir Valley, it was a place of unparalleled natural beauty and rich cultural heritage. However, beneath this idyllic facade, the city concealed deep-rooted social, political, and economic issues. This essay will discuss the complex problems that the old city of Srinagar was grappling with at the beginning of the new decade, focusing on issues related to urban planning, poverty, and political unrest. 

First and foremost, the old city's urban planning was in a state of crisis. The labyrinthine streets, once the lifeblood of this ancient urban center, were now choked with traffic. The haphazard expansion of the city, coupled with a lack of infrastructure and basic services, had led to numerous issues. For instance, there was a severe shortage of clean water and sanitation facilities. Inadequate waste management systems and a dependence on traditional wood-burning stoves for heating during the brutal winters resulted in high levels of air pollution.

story: When Donna was a little girl, she had a dog named Sandy.
text:
When Donna was a little girl, she had a dog named Sandy. The canine companion was a faithful friend, always by her side as she explored the wooded trails near her childhood home. Donna's bond with Sandy deepened as the years passed, and the dog became more than just a pet  she was a cherished member of the family. 

As Donna grew older, her responsibilities expanded beyond the care of her beloved pet. She entered college and began to pursue a degree in veterinary medicine, fueled by her passion for animals and her desire to help them live healthy, happy lives. Her studies were rigorous and demanding, requiring her to master a wide range of subjects  anatomy, physiology, pharmacology, and pathology, to name a few. 

Despite the challenges she faced, Donna persevered, determined to achieve her goal. She spent countless hours poring over textbooks and taking notes, diligently absorbing the information presented to her. Her professors, impressed by her dedication and intelligence, took notice of her outstanding academic performance.

label: A2
story: Lisa loves to go shopping. Tomorrow she is going shopping.
text:
Lisa loves to go shopping. Tomorrow she is going shopping. She buys fruits and vegetables. At the market, she meets her friend Anna. They greet each other happily. Anna also loves to shop. Together, they buy bread and cheese. But Lisa forgets her wallet. Anna lends her money. They continue shopping with a smile. Later, they prepare a meal and enjoy it together. Lisa is grateful to Anna. They promise to go shopping again soon. 

Here are the grammar constructs used in the passage:

1. Present continuous tense: Lisa is going shopping
2. Future tense: She is going shopping tomorrow
3. Simple present tense: She buys, meets, greets, loves, forgets, lends, promises, prepare, enjoys
4. "And": Lisa buys fruits and vegetables, Together they buy bread and cheese
5. "But": But Lisa forgets her wallet
6. "Because": She is grateful to Anna because Anna lends her money. 7. Conjunctions: and, but, because. 
7. Article usage: The market, a meal. 
8. Present perfect tense: They have prepared a meal. 
9. Verb agreement: They greet each other happily.

label: C2
story: Having your kid physically attached to you probably
text:
Having your kid physically attached to you probably seems like an archaic practice in today's fast-paced world. However, there are compelling reasons to consider the benefits of babywearing, a practice that involves carrying a baby in a wrap, sling, or carrier. Not only does it provide the child with a sense of security and closeness, but it also offers numerous advantages for both the child and the parent. 

First and foremost, babywearing allows for uninterrupted bonding between infant and caregiver. Wearing a baby keeps them snug and close to their mother's or father's chest, enabling frequent touch and skin-to-skin contact. This contact releases oxytocin, a hormone that promotes feelings of love, attachment, and trust, for both parties involved. Moreover, it is a practical solution for parents who wish to multitask while caring for their child, as they can carry their baby while performing household chores or running errands. 

Furthermore, babywearing has several developmental benefits for the infant. The constant rocking motion mimics the sensation of being in the mother's womb, promoting a sense of calm and soothing them during periods of fussiness or discomfort.

label: B1
story: Nobody knows which came first: the economic crisis
text:
Nobody knows which came first: the economic crisis or the political instability. The global financial crisis of 2008 had far-reaching consequences, not only for the economy but also for the political landscape. In some countries, the economic downturn exacerbated existing political tensions, resulting in social unrest and even regime change. 

The housing market bubble was the primary trigger of the financial crisis. Banks lent too much money to people who couldn't afford to pay it back. They sold these risky loans as securities to investors. When the housing market collapsed, these securities lost their value, and investors experienced significant losses. This created a domino effect, leading to a global economic crisis. 

Meanwhile, some governments reacted too late or inadequately to prevent or mitigate the crisis. The lack of trust in these governments grew, and people demanded change. In some countries, protests erupted, and political leaders were forced to resign. The Arab Spring, which started in Tunisia in 2010, is a prime example of how the economic crisis fueled political upheaval.

label: A2
story: Gary Johnson and Virgil Goode have no chance of winning

John Kasich might win some votes in Ohio, but Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump will get most of them. Clinton and Trump have been campaigning hard in key battleground states. Clinton's popularity is higher than Trump's. She's more experienced in politics. Trump's controversial comments sometimes hurt his campaign. 

Clinton's supporters think she's qualified to be president. They believe she'll protect the interests of the middle class. Trump's supporters are passionate about his promise to make America great again. But, some voters are concerned about his temperament. They think he's not ready to lead the country. 

Bernie Sanders endorsed Clinton recently. This is a major boost for her campaign. Sanders supporters will join her team. Some of them are not happy about it. They still believe Sanders would have been a better candidate. But, they'll vote for Clinton to keep Trump out of the White House.

story: Riding the bus is as easy as pie. The bus driver is
text:
Riding the bus is as easy as pie. The bus driver is nice, he helps me when I want to get on. I sit by the window, looking out at the beautiful flowers. I like bus rides, they make me feel free. My house is small but cozy. I live with my mom, dad, and little sister. We have a cat named Fluffy. Fluffy purrs when I stroke her soft fur. My favorite food is pizza, with lots of cheese and tomatoes. Sometimes, I play soccer with my friends in the park. After the game, we go to my house, eat pizza, and watch a movie. My dog, Max, always waits for me by the door when I come home. Max wags his tail and jumps in happiness. I love my pet, he's my best friend. Every evening, I read a book before going to bed. Reading relaxes me and makes me dream. At night, I look at the stars and make a wish. My wishes are simple, like having a happy family and good friends. That's all I can say now, but I'll be glad to tell you more if you ask. 

(Note: The CEFR level A1 grammar constructs used in the text are: articles, simple past tense, possessive pronouns, basic expressions, comparative form, simple present tense, prepositions, and simple conditionals.)

Mary's heart skipped a beat.

These additions were designed to alleviate the burdens faced by those who had previously been underserved or excluded by the health care system. 

Moreover, the legislation also addressed the issue of escalating medical costs by implementing price caps and negotiating lower prices for prescription medications.

label: C1
story: Gary Johnson and Virgil Goode have no chance of winning
text:
Gary Johnson and Virgil Goode have no chance of winning the upcoming presidential elections, despite their unique perspectives and unconventional approaches. Their third-party campaigns, Libertarian and Constitution parties respectively, lack the resources, organization, and public support necessary to challenge the major parties. 

Johnson, a former two-term Governor of New Mexico, has based his campaign on limited government and personal liberties. He advocates for free markets, individual freedom, and a non-interventionist foreign policy, which resonates with many disillusioned voters. Goode, a former Congressman from Virginia, ran as a Libertarian in 2012 and is now seeking the constitutionalist vote. He emphasizes the importance of constitutional governance, fiscal responsibility, and border security. 

However, the electoral landscape is stacked against third-party candidates. The United States electoral system favors a two-party duopoly, as it does not provide incentives for voters to cast ballots for third parties.

label: A2
story: Having your kid physically attached to you probably
text:
Having your kid physically attached to you probably isn't ideal for either of you. He needs space to move and explore, and you need some freedom. Yet, there are moments when keeping him close brings comfort. 

At the market, for instance, the noise and the crowd make me anxious. I hold him tight because I feel safer that way. The same goes for public transport. The constant movement and the tight spaces make me uneasy, and he seems to sense it. He clings to me, and I hold him because I want to calm him down and feel more at ease myself. 

On the other hand, when we go to the park, I encourage him to run around and play. The sun is shining, and the birds are singing. He is full of energy, and I want him to enjoy the day. So, I let go of his hand and watch him from a distance. I am proud of his independence, and I know he needs this freedom to develop. 

In conclusion, there are times when it's best for my child to be close to me, and there are times when it's best for him to be independent. I need to balance these moments and find the right way to keep him safe and help him grow.

label: B2
story: Nobody knows which came first: the economic crisis
text:
Nobody knows which came first: the economic crisis or the political turmoil. However, it is widely accepted that the two are deeply interconnected. The global financial crisis of 2008 marked the beginning of a tumultuous decade for many countries and their governments, particularly in Europe. 

The crisis, triggered by the collapse of the US housing market, led to a wave of defaults, bankruptcies, and bank runs. Financial institutions and governments struggled to contain the contagion effect, which spread rapidly from the United States to Europe and eventually to other parts of the world. This resulted in a severe contraction of credit, a plummeting stock market, and a sharp increase in unemployment. 

Europe was hit especially hard, with Greece being the most prominent example. The Greek economy was already in a precarious state, with high levels of debt and a bloated public sector. When it became clear that Greece could not repay its debts, the EU and the International Monetary Fund stepped in to provide a bailout.

label: A1
story: Writing in the journal Nature, former president of
text:
Writing in the journal Nature, former president of the United States, Barack Obama, shares his love for nature and outdoor activities. He mentions his favorite hobby: "hike in forest." He explains how he enjoys "fresh air, quiet," and the beauty of "trees, birds, animals." 

Obama also talks about his pet, a dog named Bo. He says Bo is a "friendly, loyal companion." He shares how Bo "joins him on hikes," and "loves to play fetch." 

The 44th president of the USA describes his family as well. He has two daughters, Malia and Natasha. He shares that they love art, music, and sports. Malia, the elder, went to college in New York City. Natasha, the younger, still lives with the family in Washington D. C. 

Despite his busy schedule, Obama makes time for his hobbies and family. He believes that nature and loved ones bring him happiness. He writes, "Nature, Bo, Malia, Natasha make my life richer, more meaningful." 

In conclusion, Obama's writing demonstrates his appreciation for the simple things in life. He enjoys being in nature, spending time with his loyal companion, and nurturing relationships with his family.

label: B1
story: When Larry Pizzi, a veteran bicycle industry executive,
text:
When Larry Pizzi, a veteran bicycle industry executive, decided it was time for him to retire, he knew he wanted to do something more meaningful with his post-career years. Having spent decades in the fast-paced world of business, he longed for a slower pace and a sense of community. So, he turned to his favorite pastime: gardening. 

Larry's garden was a source of pride for him, a personal sanctuary where he could nurture flowers and vegetables in the quiet serenity of nature. But as he aged, the physical demands of gardening became more challenging. He realized that he could use his skills and resources to make a difference in his community. 

So, Larry began planning a community garden in the empty lot behind his local elementary school. He gathered support from the school's principal and other community leaders. Together, they secured funding, recruited volunteers, and purchased essential gardening tools and supplies. 

The garden quickly became a hub of activity, with children helping to plant seeds, tend to the plants, and harvest vegetables.

It was Saturday morning. Mary walked out of her house , feeling a sense of exhilaration in the crisp autumn air. The sun had just begun to peek over the horizon, casting an amber glow upon the tranquil landscape. She inhaled deeply, savoring the symphony of nature that surrounded her. 

The autumn leaves, painted in vibrant hues of orange, red, and gold, danced in the gentle wind, creating a mesmerizing spectacle. The rustling of the leaves was a soft counterpoint to the melody of the birdsong, filling the air with a soothing harmony. Mary's heart swelled with gratitude for this picturesque scene, a respite from the mundane routine of her daily life. 

As she continued her leisurely stroll, she began to contemplate the passage of time, its relentless march and the inexorable change it brings. She mused upon the fleeting nature of beauty and how it can transform the mundane into the extraordinary. The seasons, she thought, were a constant reminder of this impermanence, the cyclical nature of life, the eternal flux of existence.

label: B2
story: Narrow passage of a sweeping health care bill by the
text:
Narrow passage of a sweeping health care bill by the Senate has left many Americans apprehensive about the future of their medical coverage. The proposed legislation, which includes significant cuts to Medicaid and the repeal of several key Affordable Care Act provisions, has elicited passionate debate from both sides of the aisle. While proponents argue that these changes are necessary to reduce the federal deficit and provide greater freedom to states, critics claim that they will result in millions of Americans losing coverage and increased health care costs for many more. 

The bill, which passed in a party-line vote, has been described as a major victory for Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell and the Republican Party. Yet, it faces an uncertain future in the House of Representatives, where Speaker Paul Ryan has expressed skepticism about certain aspects of the bill. The House is expected to consider the legislation in the coming weeks. 

At the heart of the debate are the proposed changes to Medicaid, the joint federal-state health care program for low-income individuals and families.

label: A2
story: When Donna was a little girl, she had a dog named Sandy.
text:
When Donna was a little girl, she had a dog named Sandy. She and Sandy were best friends. They went everywhere together. Sandy followed Donna to school, to the playground, and to the park. Donna loved to play with Sandy. They would run and jump and roll in the grass. 

But one day, Sandy got sick. Donna was very worried. She took Sandy to the veterinarian. The vet gave Sandy some medicine and told Donna to take good care of her. Donna did everything the vet said. She gave Sandy the medicine on time and made sure she got plenty of rest. 

Because of Donna's care, Sandy got better. She played and ran around again, just like before. Donna was so happy. She was proud of herself for taking care of her beloved pet. From that day on, Donna knew that she could take care of anything that came her way. 

In the evening, Donna and Sandy sat on the porch. They watched the sun set and listened to the sounds of the night. Donna thought about the day and how much she had learned. She was grateful for her friend Sandy and for the lessons she had taught her.

label: C1
story: Having your kid physically attached to you probably
text:
Having your kid physically attached to you probably sounds like an archaic concept in today's fast-paced world. However, the practice of babywearing, an age-old technique of carrying infants and toddlers in slings, wraps, or carriers, has been gaining considerable popularity in recent times. This trend is not merely a passing fad; it boasts numerous benefits for both the child and the parent. 

Firstly, babywearing promotes closer bonding between the parent and the child. The skin-to-skin contact stimulates the release of oxytocin, the love hormone, in the parent, strengthening the emotional connection between them. For the child, the familiar heartbeat and warmth of their parent's body provides them with a sense of security and comfort. In a study published in the Journal of Obstetrics and Gynecology, newborn infants who were carried in a wrap for three hours a day cried less than those who were not (Goldenberg, 2012). 

Moreover, babywearing offers practical advantages for the parent. Carrying your baby leaves your hands free, enabling you to accomplish daily tasks without being tethered to a stroller or baby seat.

I have a lovely cat named Whiskers. He is soft and furry, with big beautiful eyes. Whiskers sleeps a lot and loves to eat fish. He jumps and plays when I move his toy mouse. In the evening, he purrs and sits on my lap, making me feel warm and cozy. 

People can travel in different ways, such as by plane, train, or automobile. I prefer flying, as it is quick and comfortable. However, trains are great for longer journeys because you can relax, watch the scenery, and sometimes there's a dining car. Cars can take you anywhere, anytime, and are convenient for short trips. 

When I was a kid, I enjoyed playing games outside with my siblings. We would build forts from boxes, have a picnic in the park, or ride our bikes. Now, I like to watch movies, read books, and listen to music in my free time.

label: C2
story: Nobody knows which came first: the economic crisis
text:
Nobody knows which came first: the economic crisis or the political instability. What is apparent, however, is that these two interconnected phenomena have brought about a perfect storm, leaving countless lives upended and economies shattered. The once booming industries have crumbled under the weight of unpayable debts and mounting unemployment. 

In the wake of this calamitous confluence, governments and international organizations have proposed various solutions, each claiming to be the panacea for the global malaise. Yet, the complexity of the issue demands a multifaceted approach, one that addresses not only economic woes but also the underlying causes  be they political, social, or structural. 

At the core of the crisis lies a fundamental imbalance: a disparity between the haves and the have-nots, exacerbated by the relentless pursuit of profit at the expense of people. This is not to say that economic growth is an inherently nefarious goal. Quite the contrary, it is a necessary condition for the alleviation of poverty and the creation of opportunities for upward mobility.

story: Up, down. Up, down. Billy was doing pushups. His arms
text:

Beside him, children played in the sandpit. Their laughter filled the air. A couple walked hand in hand, their eyes locked. A dog chased a frisbee through the open grassy space. The peaceful scene seemed to go on forever.

label: A2
story: It was Saturday morning. Mary walked out of her house

label: C2
story: Narrow passage of a sweeping health care bill by the
text:
Narrow passage of a sweeping health care bill by the Senate, following contentious debates and intricate negotiations, has left many advocates of reform feeling a sense of both relief and dismay. With this legislation, the United States is poised to make significant strides towards expanding health care coverage to millions of uninsured citizens, a feat unaccomplished since the inception of the Affordable Care Act in 2010. 

The proposed legislation, which is an intricate amalgamation of bipartisan concessions, aims to address a myriad of healthcare concerns, including lowering premiums for individuals and families, bolstering protections for those with preexisting conditions, and expanding access to telehealth services. Moreover, it includes provisions that target prescription drug costs, a contentious issue for numerous Americans, thereby providing much-needed relief to a substantial portion of the population. 

However, despite the numerous advancements contained within the bill, some critics argue that it fails to go far enough in addressing fundamental flaws within the healthcare system.

label: B1
story: Paul Walker's brothers are helping fill in small gaps
text:
Paul Walker's brothers are helping fill in small gaps left by the late renowned actor. Cody Walker joined the Fast & Furious franchise, playing the role of Jesse in "Fast & Furious 7" following Paul's tragic death. In addition, Caleb Walker took over Paul's stunt doubling duties in the same film.

label: A2
story: Nobody knows which came first: the economic crisis
text:
Nobody knows which came first: the economic crisis or the high unemployment rate. Many people lost their jobs recently, and this situation is very difficult. It causes a lot of worries and stress. Some people have to look for work every day. They go to job interviews, but they don't get offers. Sometimes, they feel demotivated and frustrated. 

Life is hard for them. They have to pay their bills and support their families. Some even have to choose between food and medicine. This situation is not fair, and it is not good for the country. We need solutions. The government must help us. They can create new jobs and invest in education. They can also reduce taxes for businesses, so they hire more people. 

Meanwhile, we can try to find ways to help ourselves. We can learn new skills or start our own businesses. We can also volunteer in organizations that help the needy. We have to be positive and keep trying. We cannot give up. The future is uncertain, but we can make it better. Let's work together and build a better tomorrow.

Yet, before indulging in the pleasures of life, he preferred to commence with the more arduous tasks at hand. His muscles screamed in protest, but Billy pressed on, fueled by a deep-seated desire for greatness. 

As his body contorted into various positions, his thoughts turned to the myriad challenges faced in his professional life. A complex project loomed ominously on the horizon. The deadline approached, and his team, though talented, lacked cohesion. Fragmented communication channels and differing perspectives threatened to derail their efforts.

story: Narrow passage of a sweeping health care bill by the
text:
Narrow passage of a sweeping health care bill by the Senate brings about heated debates among American people. Some, mainly Democrats, believe that it is essential to pass the bill because it guarantees affordable health insurance for all. On the other hand, critics argue that the proposed bill contains too many loopholes, which could lead to rising costs for individuals and businesses in the long run. 

Despite these concerns, supporters maintain their position, insisting that the benefits to be gained from the bill far outweigh the potential problems. They assert that everyone should have access to medical care, no matter their financial situation. Moreover, they argue that the bill will bring down overall healthcare costs and provide essential coverage for people with pre-existing conditions. 

In contrast, opponents argue that the proposed bill will result in increased premiums and taxes. They believe that the government should not force people to buy insurance against their will and that the market should be left to regulate itself.

label: B1
story: Many of the major supermarket chains have come under
text:
Many of the major supermarket chains have come under scrutiny in recent times due to allegations of unethical business practices and monopolistic tendencies. One such chain, which has been making headlines, is Walmart. Despite being known for its "every day low prices," the world's largest company by revenue faces criticism regarding its employment practices and impact on local communities and small businesses. 

Firstly, critics argue that Walmart pays its employees inadequately. The median hourly wage for a Walmart worker hovers around $12 an hour, well below the living wage in many of the areas where its stores are located. This has led to calls for an increase in the minimum wage to better reflect the cost of living. 

Secondly, Walmart's dominance in the retail sector has raised concerns about competition and monopolistic tendencies. With over 10,000 stores worldwide, the company's market share in several product categories exceeds 50 percent. This monopolistic position enables the chain to dictate prices and squeeze suppliers, leaving small businesses struggling to compete.

label: C1
story: Nobody knows which came first: the economic crisis
text:
Nobody knows which came first: the economic crisis or the political instability. It is a chicken-and-egg conundrum that has puzzled scholars and policymakers alike, as they try to decipher the intricate web of cause-and-effect relationships between these two phenomena. However, one thing is certain: since the onset of the crisis in 2008, the political landscape of many countries has undergone seismic shifts, with far-reaching consequences that are still being felt today. 

At the heart of the crisis was a perfect storm of factors. The bursting of the housing bubble in the United States, coupled with the ensuing financial crisis, unleashed a wave of panic and uncertainty that spread across global markets. Governments and central banks, desperate to prevent a complete economic meltdown, intervened with massive infusions of liquidity and bailouts of financial institutions. But these measures, however necessary they may have been, came at a cost. 

One of the most significant costs was the erosion of public trust in political institutions.

label: C2
story: Up, down. Up, down. Billy was doing pushups. His arms
text:
Up, down. Up, down. Billy was doing pushups. His arms ached, but he persisted, driven by an unyielding determination. The sun began to dip below the horizon, casting long shadows across the park. The air grew cooler, signaling the encroaching twilight. 

Billy continued his exercise regimen, fueled by the knowledge that each rep brought him one step closer to his goal. He had spent countless hours in the gym, his muscles straining and growing stronger with each passing day. But this was not just about physical strength; it was about mental fortitude as well. 

The park was now deserted, save for the occasional stray dog or late-night runner. Billy's focus never wavered. He counted each repetition in his head, each exhale a moment of relief, each inhale a call to action. His heart pounded steadily in his chest, a testament to his unyielding determination. 

As the darkness deepened, the sounds of the night began to awaken. The gentle hoot of an owl, the soft padding of a fox in the underbrush. Yet, through the cacophony of the night, Billy remained undeterred.

Inside, there are pictures of friends and family, some of whom have long departed from our lives. These photographs document moments of happiness and joy, capturing memories that have endured through the test of time. 

Another cherished object is a handwritten letter from a dear friend. The ink is faded, the paper is brittle, but every word still resonates strongly. The letter, written years ago, conveyed heartfelt advice and words of encouragement during a time of need. Re-reading it brings back a sense of comfort and strength, a reminder of the support we've received from those we hold closest to us.

story: Many of the major supermarket chains have come under
text:
Many of the major supermarket chains have come under intense scrutiny in recent times due to accusations of unethical business practices, particularly in relation to their suppliers and labour conditions. One such instance involves the treatment of workers in the agricultural sector, who are often subjected to long hours, low wages, and hazardous working conditions. 

These allegations have given rise to a heated debate within society, with advocacy groups calling for greater transparency and accountability from supermarkets and governments. Proponents of stricter regulations argue that the current system allows for exploitation of vulnerable workers and enables corporations to cut corners in the name of profit. 

On the other hand, some argue that these supermarkets are simply responding to the market demand for affordable food, and that the responsibility for fair labor practices should lie with the governments of the countries where the suppliers are located. Furthermore, they point out that the cost of implementing stricter labor regulations could ultimately be passed on to consumers in the form of higher food prices.

label: A2
story: Up, down. Up, down. Billy was doing pushups. His arms
text:
Up, down. Up, down. Billy was doing pushups. His arms got tired quickly. He stopped, took a deep breath. He looked at the clock. Time passed slowly. Suddenly, the door opened. A teacher entered. 

Billy sat up straight. He was in trouble. The teacher scolded him, "Why weren't you focusing in class?" she asked. 

Billy hesitated. He thought about his response. "I'm sorry," he said, "but I couldn't concentrate. I was feeling very tired." 

The teacher looked at him sternly. "You need to try harder," she said. But Billy knew that wasn't enough. He had to do something to stay awake during her lessons. 

So, he made a decision. Every night he studied before bed. He read books and did exercises to improve his strength. In the morning, he drank coffee to keep his energy up. During class, he took notes and asked questions. He focused on the teacher's words. 

It was hard work, but it paid off. Gradually, Billy became more alert in class. He understood the lessons better and even started to enjoy learning. The teacher noticed the change and smiled approvingly.

label: C1
story: Narrow passage of a sweeping health care bill by the
text:
Narrow passage of a sweeping health care bill by the Senate, which would significantly impact the lives of millions of American citizens, has sparked an intense political debate. The Affordable Care Act, popularly known as Obamacare, has been a subject of controversy since its inception. Critics argue that it imposes an undue burden on taxpayers, while supporters claim it protects the health and well-being of the vulnerable population. 

The proposed Senate bill, titled the Better Care Reconciliation Act, aims to repeal and replace certain provisions of Obamacare. This bill, if passed, will have profound effects on the American health care system. One of the most contentious issues is the reduction in funding for Medicaid, a government health care program for the low-income population. The bill seeks to cap federal Medicaid spending, which will ultimately force states to make difficult choices between funding this program and other essential services. 

Furthermore, the proposed bill eliminates the individual mandate requiring Americans to purchase health insurance or face a penalty.
